Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the rules of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since you have completed this book, which is the last part of the science of medicine, for the completion of its consequence, and for its explanations, and for its declarations, it seems to me that you complete it at your own pace in this treatise, which is a part of the operation with my hand, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation with my hand is spread throughout our region and in our time of total privacy, until they strongly perceive the science of it, and its vigilance is established; and no one remained of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which muddy the hands and endeavor to correct those errors and hesitations until the intentions of it are closed and its force is elongated and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you will vivify this order of this treatise in the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that you may come into possession of the forms of the ferramentz of cautery and of the other instruments of the work, as it is for addition of the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no artificial expert is found in our time, is that the art of medicine is long, and it covers the actor who needs to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which Galen discovered until he knew the juvenation of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and he had knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the number of them, and their size; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the places of their issuance.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that Hippocrates said that a name is a word, mostly in small works, and greatly in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already said that in the introduction of this book; because whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy, is not exempt from error, for which they will be mortally wounded, thus you have seen many of them, because few are formed in this science and get away from it with their experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because you have seen a foolish doctor who has inadvertently induced an scrophilous abscess in the neck of a woman, and has cut some arteries of the neck so that great bleeding occurs until the woman almost dies between his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who pretended that he would remove a stone from a man's bladder, which had progressed to his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and performed a trephine operation on the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called him a destroyer of that, and I saw that because of the greatness of the stone and because of the disposition of the patient's body, he would know that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he ended up with a black crust that was on the fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he destroyed the fracture, above the wound, with poultices and astellas in strong structure, and did not leave the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he dislocated according to his own desires, and then he relieved, and then he left it for several days and commanded that we should not touch the limb; and it was thus until the thigh and the foot became apostematous, and he came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have already called him a destroyer, and he was unable to dislocate the limb, and consequently it was tranquilized and thus he was free from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so that he could not restrain it, and he did not cease to walk with the corruption in the limb until the patient became worse.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous abscess, and he ulcerated it for several days, until the malice of it was magnified in his lord's sight.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the cancerous tumor was pure melancholic humor, then it did not cover that it would come to him with iron of all, but rather it was in a member which suffered from all, as if it had been held.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that, sons, it is necessary for you to know that the operation with my hand is divided into two devotions: one is an operation associated with health, and another work in which there is danger in major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed in every place of this book where you found operation in which there is error and fear; because it is necessary for you to guard against that and leave it, so that the fools do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take up your arms in solicitude and protection of God, and your evils are abolished and confirmed.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And you will be on the best way for the grace of God, persevering in salvation and laudable success, and you will leave the terrible evils of difficult healing, and you will put away your arms from that which makes you fear, so that you may establish faith in your heart and in your name you may not be evasive: because more remains to your glory, and afterwards in the world and finally to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Because there are many useless medicines:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	There is no medicine for evil, because bad doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first partition.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the head and feet, in the forms of instruments and in the preparations of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second partition.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on suction and perforation, and on cupping glasses, and on poultices, and on the extraction of arrows and on similarities to those, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third partition.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twisted limbs and similarities to those; a chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and acute medicine and recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Here begins the treatise on the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will discuss the quality of the juices of that cautery and of its instruments, and in which complexions it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the juice of cautery and its instrument is long and prolix, subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they are discordant, and I need a small part of their sermons, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery confers on the whole universal complexion, which is either material or non-material, except for two complexions, which are cold complexions without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry complexions there is discord; for some said that cautery is juice against that, and others said the contrary, that cautery is not convenient in evil complexions which are by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that evil cold and dry complexions are healed by cautery which is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say to him who says the contrary, that by cautery it is made juice in all evil cold and dry complexions that are found in men's bodies, because when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the complexion of fire, you find the body of man to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say through the sermon of that, that I have experimented and already discovered many times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	Moreover, I do not know that someone has written about that which is already experienced and exercised in the chapter on cautery through previous exercise, and has known the diversity of complexions in men's bodies and the disposition of evils in their metesises, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	Moreover, in the other complexions, it is not about your fear, and especially in cold and humid evils, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree on the juice with cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, sons, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and its goodness, so on cautery as combined medicine, is because fire is simple, whose action does not penetrate except to the member which is cauterized and does not harm another member unless it is a small nuisance.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Moreover, the action of combined medicine penetrates to that in the members which are afflicted by it, and strongly makes them come into the difficult-to-heal member and strongly helps them.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Moreover, fire, by its sublimity and goodness of substance, does not make anything except that it overflows; and it is already known to us through experiment and long service of study in the art about the truth of causes; and for this I have excused the length of the sermon; and if it were not that I do not read my own book in this passage to you, secretly hidden with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of the expulsion through which it expels evils, a philosophical demonstration sermon, which will be acute in your pious pages.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to use cautery and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the nuisance from the accidental time is submerged in the juice of that which is attracted by cautery, and especially if cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fast, which do not suffer delay so that it is feared for those that bring evil, which is greater than small nuisance entering for a short time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus I do not catch in your pages, or, sons, that which is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that for that evil which is healed by cautery, it does not return at all times, and pauses that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not so, because they do not understand that cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humidity which are causes for why pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	More masters excel in superficial medicine for the will to validate their worth and virtue of their operation and greatness of their lord's sense.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness returns at some point in time, according to the complexity of the patient and the location of their illness, and its virtue, and what has been prepared in their body by the aggregation of superfluous fluids, and what they have acquired through their habits and similarities with those causes; but that the illness for which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness in few superfluous and humid parts, thus as if cauterization is done for toothache and similar to that, it is possible that the pain does not return there, more so it happens in small children.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common speech is that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, and it is a desperate remedy, not to what they understand in it, because they believe that it is not a cure that profits from medicine nor another cause that profits from cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cauterization is the last resort of medicine is not but when we administer various methods of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer, and then at the end of the cause we administer thus cauterization, and it profits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And henceforth I say that cauterization is not the last resort of medicine, but according to the intention which understands the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that gold cauteries are better than iron cauteries, and they did not say so except for the equality of gold and the limitation of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not make a scar, as if it is not absolutely virtuous, because you have already practiced and experienced that it does not do so except in certain bodies among others, and cauterization with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; but more masters when you make cauterization with a focus of gold, it is not for you to declare, because it is according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and prepare to receive freshness; and if you adjust on top of the ignition, the gold makes a focus for the fire, and in the fire some laminas are made so that the artisan can occupy himself with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore it is done to make cauterization with iron, we do not push lightly and do not approach closely to the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that one can lift the demanding part that wants it from them.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterization of head pain due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers on the humidity and coldness above the servile accident of which there are two causes, so it is the cause of swelling and multitude of flux rheumatic, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the ears and eyebrows fluent, and multitude of drowsiness, and of toothache and of gout, and universally of all illness that comes from coldness, thus as paralytically, swelling and apoplexy, and similarly in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this, that primarily it commands the patient to evacuate in medicine laxative the whole mind, for three or four nights, according to the virtue of the patient and their age and their custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his whole head with a razor, and then do so that he sits between his thighs on a heated bench and places his hands over his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor of your palm then put your fingers on the razor at the bridge of the nose between the eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More masters, since the finger said of my own place is arrived, signifying that place with a probe, and then ignite the olive oil cauterization of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the sensitive place with a probe, in a way that descends, at which the finger of the hand is constricted little by little, and you turn that around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and regard the place, and if you see that some quantity of the head is discovered, thus as the quantity of grains of errors, then lift your hand, and if it does not return to your hand in that iron, in another of that, if it is inflamed, until it is seen by the eye what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve that over the place and leave that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the sewn wound in a bandage and leave that on until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with four-part medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plague breaks out, so much better gets the scar, because it is better and more youthful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that some of them who are cauterized on the back of the eye, and hold the cautery until it is adhered to some part of the spectacle of the eye.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And it is necessary to adjust what adheres to the bone, and it is necessary to cure.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	There are others who apply the cautery to the rear, until it penetrates into the bone strongly, so that the bone is seized, and this is the method of small abscesses.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place exudes the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And it has been held in the open wound for a long time, and it is necessary to cure until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two special kinds of cauteries in total, unless in some homes according to the way of fear; and therefore, you should tell me, it is better for my health, when it is; because the head is developed by solution of continuity of the aforementioned, as we have testified in other members, and mainly when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is most safe and better for me; and from that house and I do that work for my health.
Capitol segon.	Following chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the entire head is affected by chronic and long pain, and it is in prolonged illness, and uses remedies of gerras and cochias and capipurges and emplaustres and guatz and cadels and gualinas and semblantz, and mainly if it has been cauterized with a cautery that recounts and does not alleviate any of those causes, then consider that the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not frail and atrophied from great cold, then that cauterying is another kind of cautery beneath that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And it is necessary to cautery above the horn of the dry head with a cautery until the cord is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the cord and discover the bone with the quantity that we have recounted and cautery it with a cautery in the rear part of the head at the place called "vas" - and it is that place where the wind is paused.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand in that way, and do not discover the bone, because the patient suffers from great diverse pain, unlike the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will direct this cautery to its place, because it is known that the cautery is the one that cauteries the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than the one that is cauterized in the middle of the head; and this is the method of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery of non-ancient migrating [humors].
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the head, or it is extended to the vein, then evacuate with medicines that mundify the head, and another cure should be administered, which you have described in the divisions of illnesses; and if all does not alleviate, then cauterying is done in two ways: either cauterying with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A cauterying with acute burning medicine is that you take a piece of alum, and scrape it and bind the extremities of it to both ends of the heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And it is necessary to incise the place of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until it reaches the bone beneath the cord, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And it is necessary to apply pressure above it with a stopped descent constriction, and let it be for three hours; and then dislodge it and draw out the alum, and let the wound be for two or three days, and then pause on the covered area submerged in water until the place makes a scab.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to cure that with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you see, make those some burning medicines which I have written in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	A cauterying with iron is done according to this method: ignite for cautering of which this is the form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is like a form of key in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And it is necessary to pause on the place of pain, and hold your hand — so that the acidity which is beneath does not hurt — and turn the small iron little by little with velocity.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is hurt by the specificity of the cord is as much as the size of it, and hold your hand so that the artery is not hurt beneath, so that there is no flux of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to soak the area in salt water and pause it on the place, and let it be for three days; and then pause the area wrapped in bandage, and cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cautery the extremity of the cutaneous area according to cautery, and beware of incision of the artery in this non-ancient migrating [humors] properly.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cautery of ancient migrating [humors].
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an acute case that we have spoken of in the previous treatment, and what we have said about the divisions of the illnesses, and do not hasten the treatment, and sometimes for the illness that does not respond to what we have said about the first cautery in medicine or the cautery in focus, then it is necessary that you ignore the cautery cut into the skin so that it becomes white, since it indicates on the line of the long bone where the greatest pain is; and place your hand for a while and strengthen it until you reach the artery and penetrate to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	It is necessary for you to take care of the continuity of the jawbone, which is essential for chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves are not damaged in a way that would hinder its function.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood in the artery that is affected, because in its affection there is fear, and major attention to the one who ignores what it does and is not studied and experienced; and thus the operation begins on it at the commencement.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find a reminder of the rule for the flow of blood in the affected artery according to its own manner, in the same place of this free book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not respond to this cautery and you see the body of the patient is tolerable, then cauterize it in the same place on the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on the stretching of the arteries with cautery having two horns, and it is a better cauterization than this one and more convenient.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from cold and it is treated with causal laxatives and other treatments which we have said in the division, and the pain is not alleviated, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one that has been named punctured, of which this is the form.
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And point the cautery to the ignition, and it is led to the environment of the whole ear in a circular motion, or in the circle of some points if the pain is in some.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Gradually move the cautery along the root of the ear, little by little, until you reach the spot where you feel it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you make points with the cautery all over the ear, and in this way, and then treat the spots until they are healthy.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of gout.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Gout which is treated and cauterized is not only of the species that come through fluxion, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	It is necessary to cauterize the species that comes from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of gout with herbs and purging and evacuations, and your treatment does not work, then it is necessary that you cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your hand on the cautery for the opposite part of the affected limb, because mollification is only effective in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the extremity of the ear, just above the horn of the head, and on the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the pain in the finger, and place your hand on the cautery until the quantity of the greatest pain of the specific code is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a species of cutting instrument, the form of which is described in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	Moreover, it is necessary to subtly understand that one should not be too confident; and it is necessary to cut into the excess fat a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the spot where it is described in the process until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of forgetfulness caused by fluxion.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give to the patient at the beginning large pills and servant mondificants.

E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And then if the health of the patient is good; and if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of their head, which descend from the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and then take care to make the cauteries in such a way that it is properly done.

De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On cauterization of melancholy.

Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On cauterization of water descending into the whirl.

E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauteryzed at the neck, below two bones with two cauteries, immediately producing.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the Cauterization of Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the veins are old and accustomed and through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest location of the head before, and it is verified that this is superfluous fluid matter, then cauteryze that same spot with a cautery, which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of inflammation in the veins, and cauteryze in the same spot on the head and with two cauteries on the temples, and with two cauteries below two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to add more, then cauteryze that entire side of the vein on the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the Cauterization of Foul Smell of the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you medicate that same spot which we have said in the division and do not hasten your medication, then prepare and give to the patient three nights' sleep; and then shave his head, and cauteryze that same spot with a lesser cautery or an olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauteryze that same spot with a clave cautery or with two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery that you do not injure it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clave cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the Cauterization of Softening of the Eyelids of the Veins.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the vein is softened by illness or humidity, then cauteryze that eyelid with a cautery and this cautery is lunar; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauteryze that above the two eyebrows a small one with two cauteries in all parts, and thus elongate the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And thus is the length of each cautery according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is affected.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the Cauterization of the Eyelid of the Vein when the Skin is Converted to the Internal Parts and Punctures the Vein.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the vein is converted to the internal parts and punctures the vein, cauteryze in that spot according to two manners, because the cautery is either with iron or with medicine combustible.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauteryze with fire, command the patient to lie down on that spot which you have readied the skin, just as if it were those which are in the world, until they are prolonged and enlarged; and if you puncture that spot before its time, then strengthen the veins of the patient with a bandage so that it is not weakened until the skin is nourished.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are nourished and enlarged, then pause the head of the patient in the same place, and place a sign above the eyelid of the veins of the patient with a tent, with a signal which is according to the figure of a leaf of myrtle, and it is the beginning of the signal proper of the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then pause with a cotton pad in an album of wool or in a mucilage of ptilli over the vein.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery, of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauteryze on the figure which has been signaled, little by little, in soft touches, until the surface of the vein is burned, which is just like the leaf of myrtle, entirely apparent properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the signal of the goodness of the work is that you see the eyelid of the vein already contracted and the skin of it elevated from the puncture of the vein.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then elevate your hand and leave it like that for three days, and then pause on it with cotton cloth bound around it until the scar is eradicated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	When the skin returns to its natural color due to some cause and the eyelid is softened, then apply another time the cautery on that entire area as if you had done it for the first time.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is on the eyelid below, then cauterize that which has been elevated to its natural place and has been bent and the skin does not touch the vein.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery is a burning medicine that commands the patient to lift the skin within so it is prolonged and bent, and then make a chart of fabric in the form of a leaf of myrtle.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some soap concoction and living water to anoint there. And apply it. Where the water is, and mix those causes well, and apply it to the fasting place so that it does not get cold; and apply it spread over the chart which was made thus in the form of a myrtle leaf, and put it on one vein of both arms; and put below the vein bent into an album of wool, and the head of the patient should be in a straight tie.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And put the finger on the medicine and press it a little and do not touch with the hand so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, because the bite is in it as from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus how you will perceive that the other bite, then release the medicine and touch it to the straight finger; thus how the biting stops, then remove the medicine and wash the vein with water; and then consider if sometimes the eyelid is lifted thus as if washed from the constriction of fire or incision, because then it is; and if not return on that of the medicine on the place where you have not impressed the medicine and do not deny until your operation is bent and the vein is constricted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then put on the outer skin to heal into order that the venom of the adjustment is eradicated, and then cure it with an ointment of definite finicon or another into order that it be healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, from your operation that you keep diligent vigilance so that the medicine does not fall on the vein, and if the eyelid for several days is softened and some cause of the skin touches the vein, then repeat your medicine on the place where the eyelid is softened, and properly thus as you did at the beginning, and then send it inside to be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the veins of men are diversified according to magnitude and smallness, and thus according to what was made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it will not be veiled the way of straight direction to that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the vein.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula with water that we have said in the divisions of the diseases and do not confuse your cure, then it is necessary that you cauterize it thus in this manner: command the patient to put their head straight in the tie, and hold the head of some minister between the ties more in such a way that it is neither veiled nor agitated at the tied head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then put outer skin on an album of wool or in a poultice of ptilli over the vein of it.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be conical, thus as it is a form of cane or of feather of vulture, from one extremity to the other where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out thus as an awl.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But especially that which is burned is better at the tied work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then take the fistula if it is opened, and draw out its sap and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then operate on it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then put on the cautery which was well ignited, and you have that in a small part of the cautery of the vein at the partition of the nose, so that it does not err with your hand or the patient is not disturbed, and then put the cautery in the grooves of the vein and corrupt it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And thus at the beginning of the vein cautery, you will see into the bone, good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if it is necessary; and leave it thus for three days, and then put on outer skin to heal and wrap it in an ointment exsiccated until it be healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if they were passing eleven days and it is not healed, then put on the medicine acute corrosive until the bone is discovered and is scraped according to what is convenient in the seventh chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And it is another manner of cautery of fistula which the first doctors discovered: then in the place of the fistula and make a hole there and put on that fissure subtly as it is the form of it: They put in it the quantity of one ounce of lead melted; and you hold your hand well with good retention, and do not veiled the patient so that the melted lead does not penetrate to the vein of it; and then put on the outer skin of the patient's vein enfused in an album of wool or in water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by marvelous sanitation.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed in a way that we have spoken of regarding the cautery and treatment, it is well; and if not, then it is necessary to administer traction from the nose and reduce the fistula to its proper place in the nose according to how it will be in its own location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	About the cauterization of the fracture of the toes.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Moth-like ulcers suddenly forming fissures on the lips, and especially on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures in the way that we have spoken of in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then ignite the small cutting cautery according to this form that is described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And it is the conquest of the patient according to the subtlety of the scalpel.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then pause that initiated cut carefully into those fissures until the cautery reaches the root of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that wounded area thoroughly until it is healthy.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	About the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth an abscess forms and then breaks, and then it is ruptured, and then it is antiquated, and you correct the break and it is made into a fistula, and then you treat that and do not deepen your treatment, then it is necessary to ignite the cautery according to the quantity that has been received in the fistula, and then you place that ignited thing in the traction of the fistula, and you hold it with your hand until it reaches the iron ignited at the root of it, and afterwards you make a scab or two; and then you heal that wounded area in the way that we have spoken of regarding the treatment until it is healthy.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the wound is absolved and healed, it is well; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and extract the corrupted bone according to how it will be in its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	About the cauterization of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and not with caution, then pause the head of the patient in the specified position, and ignite the cautery in the form that will be suitable, even so that you place the burnt point on the tooth and insert it into the gum, and hold your hand firmly until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times according to how you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then let the patient rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and afterwards stop it, because the decayed tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is stiffened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	About the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by coldness, or if there is cold or worm in it, or if the treatment with medicine does not confer, then cautery is used in two ways: either cautery with a hollow tube, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a hollow tube is that you take a hollow tube of copper and boil it in hot iron, and then take a cotton thread and wrap it around the extremity of the tube, and then immerse it in the boiling tube, and pause it over the painful tooth firmly until it is cooled down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat it several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge the cotton thread or cloth in the aforementioned tube, and pause it over the painful tooth, and hold it over the ignited iron until the iron reaches the root of the conquered tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, beware of the cauterization with fire that you attend to the quantity of iron or copper, and it is in the core of some gross material and the acuity of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that will be suitable, and pause it over the tooth and hold your hand until the cautery is cooled down; and do this several times because the pain will be relieved or on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary to impress on the patient that they should rinse their mouth with good wine and hold it for an hour and then spit it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cautery is done in whatever way you wish to do it extremely, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	About the cauterization of crooked toes.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When crooked toes are caused by flux and cold humors and do not obey the direction through medicines and you wish to direct them lightly, then you ignite the cautery in the form that is this: having two hubertas (special tubes) per extremitat, so that the smoke of the cautery goes through the other extremitat, and pause the ignited thing over the abscess once, and another time if it is necessary for that, until it reaches the root of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the abscess is small, then pause the cautery according to the quantity of the abscess, and apply a dressing for three days and place it on the affected area until it is fully cleansed so that what the fire has consumed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then heal those who are wounded and bruised, and apply ointments until they are healthy.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or the two cauteries is such that it conveys.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of wounds of the foot and of constrictions of the ankle.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture comes over the canal of the lung, and especially when that is complicated by coldness of completion, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with medicines that are laxatives, and then cauterize those who have the root of the gout in the affected area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not touch the cautery to the gout nor burn the coding of it, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize those who have another cautery at the joint of the neck in the posterior vertebrae of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be shaped like a key according to the preceding method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal those who have what is previously mentioned until they are healthy.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization of lung diseases and of coughs.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughs and lung diseases are caused by cold moistures and the patient has no fever nor thirst and it is an old disease, then cauterize those who have two cauteries on the forked part in the affected areas of the loins and hips; and another cautery in the middle part of the chest between two nipples; and let the cautery be shaped like a key according to the preceding form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be pointed with the cautery that is called a point, the form of which precedes in the pointing of pain of the ears.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points until it reaches those; and then heal those who have what is previously mentioned until they are healthy.

When the head of the helper is dislocated due to slippery moistures and does not stay in its place at the time of its return, until it is as it usually returns, and then by a small movement it is displaced thus that it ends, thus as we have testified, then it is necessary first to reduce the dislocation, and then the patient will be reversed over the two hips or over the sides; and then elevate the code which is in the partition of the citillic to the upper parts with the fingers of your left hand, if the joint is dislocated at the upper parts.

e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and thus those subtleties according to the quantity of tension; and this is their form.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold and moisture enter the stomach to the point that it extracts its completion and is multiplied in it, and if you continue the methods of cure and do not confuse them, then it is necessary that the patient be placed on their back with their arms extended and their legs, and then cauterize those who have three cauteries: one cautery below the chest for the quantity of a finger's length shaped like a key, and two cauteries below the two sides of the cautery, until the figure of the triangular cautery is formed; and elongate between those that are not adjusted so they will not putrefy.

De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the cauterization of a feverish foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When the foot hurts from cold or dampness or thick windy humidity that disturbs its normal complete function and is cured by egress of superfluous fluid, and it does not comfort, then it is necessary that the patient be placed on their back, and we will apply three cauterizations according to this form and quantity measured over the foot, below the hip joint, where one perceives the decubitus of the same.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space be which is between each cautery according to the thickness of the finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the right body.

Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess of the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an ulcer or abscess in the foot and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in its tendon, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient will feel grave trouble and sharp pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tendon of the foot, then the pain is greatly acute and often the doctors are weary of its cure.

And it is not fitting that this form of cautery be used unless the one who has studied in the art of medicine is prolonged, and in the most of which many maladies are recognized; however I have experimented with some gentle women who were bold about this operation, but I will leave that to you, and it is better.
