De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of ulcers.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauteries of the roots of aristology for ulcers frequently follow this manner of being made, and it is this that you take from the roots of aristology a long dry root which is found, and let it be of the thickness of the finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and heat it at the fire, and then cautelize with a cautery at that place which is between the continuation of the furcula and the neck; and make two small cauteries below guiding, one slightly declining to the part that is below the beard, and make two cauteries on what is declining between the fifth rib and the knee, declining slightly to the back parts; and make another cautery in the middle place of the foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauteries on the back parts; and make one cautery at that place which is between the two shoulders, and make two cauteries of the two sides of the foot, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not comprehend your hand with the cautery, unless it is in the manifest of the codena in operation.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And thus I have described the ancient cauteries which are similar to those of men who use iron-like cauteries that resemble a ray and ignite it, and place it at that spot which is between the ribs, until they reach to that abscess and healthy sanity is restored, just as I have said in the case of the foot abscess.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	However, in this perforation with cautery there is no fear, because I have often seen it happen that the cautery reaches to the spot of the fistula where there is no health.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the mole.

De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On cauterization of the thigh, afterwards prepare for their abscess to burst.

Afterwards insert that ignited rod into the abscessed thigh, and ultimately guide it inside until it reaches the orifice of the vein from which the blood flows.

Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the natural dermal layers of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work that we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, then heal them with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore when you see a fistula in the natural dermal layer, and it is old, corroding the healthy part of it and humidifying corrupting matter, and therefore that which is more worthy to cover is that which proceeds with a subtle probe, and afterwards consider the quantity of the profundity of it before the aforementioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Afterwards ignite the cautery that resembles a rod.

And hold the cautery on that until they burn those corrupt bodies entirely, one or two or three times, according to the quantity of your necessary need.

And beware of combustion of nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do it unless the fistula is in a fleshy location and you think that it does not penetrate.

E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matter has not been removed from it, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the vicinity of a corrupt bone, or something from those causes which will bring remembrance to its place.

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On the cauterization of the kidneys.

entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it becomes very red and has many sparks.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir. De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the Cauterization of Hernia.

E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not harm the nerves that are here, and that another evil does not come over the patient's other evils.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when the artery flows with blood, then it is not possible to restore the blood in those cases, and especially when the artery is large, if not one of four methods: either cautery as I have said, or extraction when it has not been extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of my veins are harmed and the blood is restored, or that it be tied with a faithful bandage or with a strong structure, or that they are stopped with medicines which have the virtue of restraining the blood; and they are strengthened in the pulvinar with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	Those who administer treatment should decently restrain themselves from lamenting and straining, and not overstep their position, lest they worsen the causes of combustion and similarity, not comforting unless it's bitter.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if one endeavors to heal and is not a present doctor, then work on the indicated pause of the said orifice with that vein, as we have said, and intend to the great constriction within so the blood is stopped from the superior part of the plague, and above the artery it is not rebuffed; and above the artery is aspirated with much cold water of great coldness within so the blood is congealed and thickened; and perhaps it is necessary to cauterize or medicate.
Comensa la segonda partida.	It begins the second treatment.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and ventosas and of phlebotomy and of sores and their similars.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the teachings of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	I have said in the first chapter all about malady in which cautery is convenient and medicine combustion, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for the forms of cauteries; and I will order the chapters of the inferior part of the head until the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter by that method, so that it may be of use to whoever needs it, then on what will be demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And therefore I begin here, certainly, sons, that you learn that in this chapter it is to terrify what is in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that which is in great caution, because in the operation which is in this chapter many evacuations are made, such as evacuation of blood with aspiration of the vein or incision on the apostema or perception of exstirpation or purification of the plague or extraction of sageta or incision of stone and their similars.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all those are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the end of their cats death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you does not fall what is in the situation, because some evacuations happen due to your mannerisms of men with mannerisms of many maladies.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them it is said that they flee from their malady and escape death, and thus for the vehemence of what they find in their malady, and for the length of their malady, and in the malady is fear which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those it is given to you to have and to say, you waiting in that sanity, and the following malady is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore you do not consent to that which is seen by you of this manner; and your caution should be greater than confidence and your rapacity; and do not presume any cause over what is certain science that verifies it in you, and to which you perceive successful praise.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And you are established in the cure of all your maladies with prognosis and indication of it which is converted health, because in that you have help above acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, God inspires your understanding and does not lack direction and protection, because that is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinctly by chapters according to what proceeds in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure from head to feet, so that it may be of use to you whatever you demand of it and whatever you need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the cure of water that is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You know that this malady many times occurs in infants from birth and when the nursery is strengthened, the head of the infant is freed from lividity.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some evacuations occur due to a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this malady except in infants; and all those whom I have seen are caught by death, and thus it is to me a lamentable work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that an infant whose head was full of water, and the head of it was always magnified until it ceased to be able to support itself because of the greatness of its head, and perhaps the humidity increased until it died from heat.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is added between the codena and the bone, or is added below the bone on the siphac.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation on it if the humidity is between the codena and the bone and the apostema is small, then you find in the middle of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and let the length of the fissure be two nodes until the humidity flows, and this is the form of the spatula.
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more augmented and the apostema is greater, then there are two fissures here according to this manner.
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, it is signified that you see the commissures of the head opened from all parts and the water is sprinkled when you comprehend this in the tie and at the internal parts and it is not what you hide.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Look for three fissures in the brain according to this method.
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract all the humidity; and then strengthen the fissures with draps and plums; and then apply something on top for six days, and then relieve the ligament and cure the plague in ten tries and bandages, and strengthen the head with equality; eat the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healthy.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers how to bring out the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of water, because some evacuated areas are more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right side, or on the left side; and therefore attend to the incision so that the abscess appears and the flow of water is released, and do it according to what is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery and avoid flowing blood and death of the patient by that flow of blood with evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	The incision of the arteries which are close to the kidneys, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter third.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When you find some catarrh or rheum in the veins or at the feet, and it is antiquated there, and it does not confer on that the cure of medicines, then the last cure is to make an incision in those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then look when you want to incise those that the patient's blood flows to their head, and make a rough drap on the surface with a pointed instrument so that the arteries appear, and make the neck of the patient strong with some drap; and consider the pulse of the vein; and the places above the places which are close to the kidneys are removed, and they are hidden until some hours.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then sew above the artery with a thread, and incise some part of some affected area near the incision penetrating into the bone, and it is done for the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, remove the spatium below the artery and cut it to equalize the incisions at the upper parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And it is the length of the incision that measures two digits adjusted, because when a vein is incised the blood is released in a pulsating outflow, which is felt before for its frequent beats.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision site, then look for the measurement of the kidney's quantity of three digit spaces, and sew above with a thread, and do it until it reaches the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that is how to stop the flow of blood which is a quantity of six ounces. and far from getting more of it, and all that is according to the quantity which appears from the strength of the patient and the replenishment of their artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the plague, and if there remains some cause of the disease on the bone, then incise it so that no abscess is left behind.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the plague with plums and ligaments of drap, and then cure it with bandages until it is healthy.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some ancient or chronic catarrh or sharpness has migrated to the temples, due to humidity and quality in the lacrimal glands of the temples, or an old vehement and similar thing to those, and it is medicated with medical cures and that does not confer, then we have progressed into these maladies extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those eyes as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of operation and extraction of those is that the patient's blood flows to the skin which is in the temples; and attend to the apparent artery in the temple because it is shown to you by the pulse, and it is hidden until a few hours due to the vehemence of the drap.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then the neck of the patient should be strengthened with some drap; and make a rough drap on the surface with a pointed instrument or evaporate the area with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the spatium of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then score the cord in that which is facilitated until you reach the artery; and take out the vein and extract it from the upper parts until you extract it from the cord and discover it from the tunics which are below it, of the entire part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then envelop it at the extremity of the vein, and incise it in one part according to the quantity for which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and there will be no flow of blood, because if they are not incised, the blood will not pour out entirely.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate six ounces of blood. until three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	If the acidity is great, then it is necessary to bind that in two places with strong double ropes or cords at length, and not to touch the putrid matter during the consolidation of the wound and stopping the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	Then cut away the excess flesh which is between two ligaments; and do it at that hour or then another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cautery inserted into the bone, cutting into it so that the extremities of it are burned, and remain in place of that bad mixture.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work because the patient has fever or is of complicated composition; for cautery is one of those causes that helps to eliminate the finishing humidity, and therefore it is better in judgement.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to extract the acidity that fills the place of ancient wound, and then pause on the decently made poultice, and then be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh and bones whole again so that it may be healthy.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if meanwhile you are working on another occasion to stop the flow of blood from the acidity, then you touch it to restrain that blood, or with a cautery, or fill the place of the wound, and strengthen your hand within so that the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes is present to you, then pause the finger on the place until the blood is congealed, and moisten the place with water of vehement coldness so that the acidity rests, and be strengthened according to what is necessary.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And it is better to extract the acidity by cauterying the vein with this cautery having two ends, since you have touched the two places tentatively, and paused sometimes, not moving much, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that what is between the extremities of it may be elongated, because they are not consolidated entirely by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And it is the acidity of the two ends together.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But emperor, if you mix the acidity of two ends together it is better, because if you sharpen them with two proper ends towards each wound, and do not burn the flesh with velocity.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, since there is some grossness in those, it has held the heat of the fire in those and the flesh is separated more lightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and more gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And it is the space which is between two ends, the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the cure of bodies of sharp and acidic humors of the wells.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the humors are acidic, and it is the body of those veins which are above the head of the bed before, and do not find in that any cause of medical cure, and sometimes the face of the patient already becomes red, and feels on the dry front of walking thus as if it were a walking of ants, and the wells of that are exhausted, humidifying thus that the skin of their son is constricted, and the eyelids are scabbed by the acidity of the tears, the ancient masters most agree in the cure of those of this operation, and no one names that cure with spat.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to walk on the skin which is on the dry front, and then make three grooves at a distance equal to the length of the front.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the groove falls into two digits: one groove is equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle place of the front, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the eyelids which are in the lacrimal, and the third of the other part.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the beginning of the acidity which is in two sides, and elongate your hand from the continuity of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each beginning is adjusted to the quantity of three digits.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of spongy material prepared or dry cloths that are moved towards the ones that dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula between two sharp extremities, of which this is the form of the incision of it:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the partition of the temples until the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Extract all that code which is between two incisions on the siphac which is above the bone, and then do it from the middle incision towards the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then straighten this spatula and insert it into the first incision, or use another instrument called a cutter, sharpened on one side and not on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the side of that sharpened part towards the adjacent flesh of the code, and the side of it beneath the bone, and employ it until it reaches the middle groove, and separate all those veins that descend from the head to the wells.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But it is continued to the incision up to that part of the code, and then do it in the middle groove until the other groove.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	Because blood flow is obstructed in quantity, express the congested areas of the blood vessels of the obstructed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And stop in any deep wound of the outer layer of the skin, and stop above those swollen veins that are inflamed and oily, and beware that you do not cause an abscess with a hot cautery.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the bandage and administer a great abundance of warm water or decoction, and then cure with basilicon ointment mixed with rose oil and other ingredients that the wounds may be healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	About the cure of ulcers caused by catarrh and also about the descending humors from the divided parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When one has catarrh coming from above and it continues, and sometimes the humors of the patient are exhausted and small, and already their strength is debilitated, and the eyelids are ulcerated and because of that the skin is rough, and in the forehead of the head there is sharp pain and subsequent inflammation, then you will know by this accident that the materials and catarrh do not come except from many veins of the divided parts above.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: that you order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in a vein on the middle of the forehead, a small one for the latitude (and begin with the incision of the left temple towards the right temple; and insert it into the bone; and stretch out your hand from the lacrimal ducts of the temples which are affected by the mastigation), until the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry out all the blood that is in the sponge or absorbent cloth and then replace it between the two lips of the wound with outer skin or absorbent cloths.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And stretch below swollen veins that are inflamed and oily, so that you do not cause an abscess with a hot cautery.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has diminished, then you should scrape the bone until it begins to form new flesh, and then cure with a regiment of desiccative ointment which makes the flesh grow, thus as if you take two parts of flour from wheat and four parts of colophony and mix them together, and make an emplastre and apply it to these wounds on the native flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	About the cure of those that fall into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The entire cause that falls into the ears is one of four species, either it is mineral pebbles or a cause similar to pebbles, thus as iron and veins, or it is from a plant thus as cress or fava, or it is a fluxing cause thus as water and oily things and their similarities, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when pebbles fall into the ear or another cause similar to those causes that do not adjust in the ear, and stop the ear from the sun, and if times the pebbles, then distill in some oily violet or sapphire, and then administer the extraction of it, and make the stomach condense, and open the nostrils to receive the event of evacuation.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then stop in the circuit of the ear with some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to the upper parts, because many evacuated matters are forgotten in these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not gotten out, then administer extraction of it with the instrument called a subtle gestatory epicicary, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten in the gestation, well; and if not, then administer extraction of it with a subtle hook of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not forgotten for that, then make a canal of iron and insert the extremity of the canal into the trunk of the ear and close the environment of the canal with wax and oily things mollified so that nothing passes except the canal.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with the strong ventilation attraction, because many evacuated matters are gathered with water that we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not forgotten in this manner, then take alumina powder or powdered vinegar apparatus which are pressed into the little quantity of wings, and stop that at the extremity of the radius, and then envelop it decently over the outer layer.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the trunk of the ear facilitated, and then extract the ear from humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And then if it is not forgotten in all the causes that we have recounted, then you will touch such a thing that an abscess or spasm will be caused.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of touching that thing is that you at the beginning sensibly open the vein of the patient and extract the blood according to the manner of the virtue of it, and then make a circle between your hands and convert the ear to the upper parts, and find a small fissure in the root of the ear where the gravity of it is first perceived.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And it is the fissure of lunar figure until it reaches the pebble, and, the pebble extracted, or removed that if you can with an appropriate instrument; and then close the fissure at that hour with velocity, and cure it until it is healthy.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	If the cause of the case is an abundance of fat that grows and becomes inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if you do not obtain obedience from your patient, then take subtle steps in this manner:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that person the removal of that fat which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not hesitate when you think that it has been moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place it in many small pieces, and try to extract those with the fingers or gestures, or with a subtle insertion, as it is said to have alleviated the extraction of it.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered the ear, it is necessary to use a sternutatory condition at the beginning, and fill the entire ear with much warm liquid, and pour it over the ear where the water is, and if it is forgotten, well; and otherwise, then take three or four lukewarm towels according to the length of the finger, and place them in the fire for a short time, and the patient will insert one of those into the hole of their ear and press on one side of that partition and percuss with another pincer on the pincer that is touching the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So, do not cease to pour water into the ear until all the water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And once the water is forgotten, then you will take pieces of paper or cotton. and place one end of it in the ear and extend the other end to the fire until it is burned by the heat of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another cotton and make so many turns until all the water is forgotten, and draw it out with a cannula as it is said to be the extraordinary pincer.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of beast that enters into that ear, if it is a small thing, then push and extract it thus, as we have said in the division; but if it is a large thing which causes pain at the time of movement, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and fingers, and the cause of it is purer than all other causes that occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of generated worms from the ear, when you cure it with water as we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and do not confuse your cure, then it is necessary that you expose the ear to sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if any cause of worms appears here, then extract it with gestures or subtle fingers, but if no cause appears, then take a straight and widened cannula, and that is the form of it.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can bear; and then suck it out with strong suction, and make many turns, until all the worms are forgotten.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obtain obedience from your patient, then operate and close in the circle of the cannula as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been experimented on by the ancients in the cure of worms, and you will find it in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is your effusion which you pour out the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form.
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or copper, straight, in which there is a small hole, and flat underneath.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it is how they fill up what is lacking in the cavity of the cannula, which will be necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and wrap it decently in the extremity of the cannula, and then pour oil into the cavity of the instrument, or juice of some herb, or whatever medicine you want to put into the cannula — and that is in the ear —, and then insert the rod with warmth underneath and express your hand on that compression tempered until the oil is expelled from the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil dripping.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been poured into the ear will have been warmed by fire for a short time.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too cold, because ear medicines do not bear it.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the Cure of Opilation of Ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some turns of certain infants are born with ears that are not perforated, and this happens in some homes, opilation in the middle of the ear due to a plague or carnation in it; and this opilation occurs in the prison of the ear canal which does not allow movement, and some turns are in the fore-part.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in its prison, which does not allow movement, is among the major dispositions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which follows movement, it is necessary that you expose the ear of the patient to sunlight and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if sometimes an apparent swelling occurs, it is above that subtle space of which this is the shape of it:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it is in which there is small latitude, of which one part is acute and the other not; and the space is of two lateral lines so that it does not touch the auricle.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And then if the swelling is from born flesh in the auricle or in its meat, then that has subtle and inclined violent facilities to enter so that all the flesh is stopped.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the swelling is in the curve of the auricle, then take subtle lateral lines and scrape off that focus on a few points, and then place them in the meat of the auricle.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And then if you feel a swelling in that which the patient is bothered by, facilitated by the gravity of ascending, it forces the oppression of it facilitated; and beware that it does not harm the nerves of the auricle.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a dressing on the auricle according to the quantity of the wide part of the bandage which you have involved in the Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or take some water and pour it into a bowl, pulverize it over the already trussed and used bandage; and if the auricle has already been apostemed, then cover so that you extract the water and permute it with another water which you will envelop in wax, so that it is made with roasting oil, until it is the apostemated cautery; and then heal it until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	Maybe you will stop the flow of blood, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the auricle, and use another cure which restrains the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure of athetosis which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athetosis which occurs in the eyelids of the eyes sometimes has humid, sometimes dry symptoms.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then it is necessary that you hold those with tenacious or incised fingers, and examine those which are the space of their roots, and then place a dressing on the already trussed areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	Maybe you have pain with flow of blood coming, then you should cauterize those with a subtle lancet-like cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is to remove the incisions and dry ulcers that return when some cause of their roots remains; and when they are cauterized, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Cure of granulations that come to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Humid matter accumulates in the eyelids of the eyes for some cause which is assembled into granulations in its strength and hardness, and thus granulation is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an addition of coarse humidity in the lower eyelid and underneath.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Then the operation in them is that you consider then if the granulation is proceeding from it in what appears on the eyelid and is mauled to the whole part; and the cause of it is laziness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make a fissure above it for the latitude, and then scrape off that whole part facilitated until it evacuates, and then suspend it with an incised finger and abscess it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Maybe you have not prepared the incision of it if you do not push to penetrate the eyelid with an incised little by little, then that is not noticed in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not overcome evil through that which the anguish of it restores and incarnates.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the granulation is declining to the deep parts of the eyelid from the superficial deepness, then evacuate the eyelid and suspend the granulation with an incised finger, otherwise you will indicate the incision, and press on that whole part, and if the eyelid by incision is prolonged, that is not noticed in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then make an incision, wash the eye with salt water; and cure the area with that which incarnates until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the cure of axirnah in the lower eyelid of the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axirnah is a grey thing which is engendered in the tunics of the lower eyelid, and it increases especially in children, aggravates the eyes of those who have it, and accelerates their catarrh; and they cannot regard the clarity of the sun's light because of that which gathers and coytans to them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And thus you often find them complaining about their eyes for a long time, and about their eyes sleeping; and so in the lower eyelids of theirs, the humid eyebrows, which have already covered inflammation, and imminence of apparent acceleration is in the eye; and when you press on the area with your fingers, you feel acceleration until it reaches them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	For some manipulation of operation is in that patient whose thighs pause the sick head on the tie, and then pause to drap of them and of their calve, and make a circle according to the quantity that it contains of total partition, and then pause that over that and press am the ties of total per that be aggregated arc in the middle of the circle, and then put an end in the middle of that humidity incident in the fissure for the latitude, and the fissure not be major than the fissure made in phlebotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	Maybe in the preceding hollow that you find the entire code within which you penetrate to reach the arc, because in the major deposits processes the arc by fissure according to the form of white greyishness.

Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of flesh wounds in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are born diverse flesh growths adjusted to those which are some cause which is assembled like a scorpion of many feet, or a many-footed polyp; and this malady is called polyp because it resembles that foot represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And of it is cancerous flesh, rough, of dark color; and of it is that it is not lion's flesh of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these lion's flesh not fraudulent nor cancerous, cover the malady with a separator between your hands and place it in the sun, and open the nostrils of it, and pierce the tendon once in those flesh.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract it from the previous parts, and then inscribe that which you have comprehended of those I have spat out subtly from one part into another so that you know that all the flesh is restored; because if there remains any cause of which the abscess is possible, then you will return to it with one of the subtle instruments facilitated in order that none of the causes remain.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it is a holy sign or an abscess, then you pause at what covers; or it is of the malignant apostemas, then you touch and cauterize that until it is absolved holy and all the cavities are restored.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then it will be cut in the nose, then the incision will agree with water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and of the processes humidity enters into the palate, then you know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate according to what covers, then you know that it is flesh in the purulent matter of the nostrils which have not been abscessed.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then cover that you put in the faithful one of the quale is some grossness, and anoint with many nuts, and pause between each nut the quantity of the said or month, and engender the malady and put in one extremity of the faithful one in the nostrils with the ray or with another cause which is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And then it will be made, that it attracts the sweet odorament into the canals of the nostrils, and it is placed on the sweet galley, because many visions resemble this action, making the children go to school, and it is a legitimate cause for one who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause the two extremities of the faithful one, one extremity that is above the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and then administer serrature of flesh in the nuts that are in the faithful one, and make it enter so that you know that the flesh is already in the nuts of the faithful one.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the faithful one, and pause in the nose according to the abstraction of a holy water, and make it for three days or more until you corrupt all that which is rotten from the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, pause in the nose a tube of lead for many days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if there are ends of treatment that exist, use those.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to make a purge, which makes distilled oils and medicines in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And if you use silver or copper, which seems like a small lantern inserted, thus with a small tube, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed tube thus like a cane, and the handle of the instrument is a flat perforator, uncovered; which has a handhold in the back of it, with which you hold that which you want to suck out of the oil or what you want of the succulent causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these perforators are precious: a recipe of infusion of castor oil, white wax, ginger, and saffron, of long pepper, of scorpion's grass, of petum of spicy anise, and an ounce. You confound with the juice of bladder and of cabbage, and thus you make pills, and a pill is distilled in warm water, and it is given to the patient lying on their back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	They are born naturally at the ends of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Moist vapors are born naturally at the ends of the nose, and they are magnificent and mentioned in several days before it is easy to observe them.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for that reason you should inject them at the beginning of their appearance, and eradicate all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then stop over the area with a cautery or burning medicine that was in place of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the injection is delayed until it becomes magnificent, then consider if it has become putrid, hard, of dark color and of little feeling, then do not touch that iron quart which is an aposteme of cruel wounds; because moist vapors are injected into that grand malice over that which it had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the aposteme is of a warm touch and not of dark color, and it seems that injection is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and inject without fear, and cure the area with water that exhales and constrains until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	About the stitching of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when continuity is dissolved by plague or by similarity.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You know that when you apply a solution of continuity to one of these cartilages, few confer benefits in that operation except in some homes.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you find some cause of those, consider if it is fresh plague with holy blood, and then you adjust the two lips of the plague with stitching, and then cure it until it is healthy.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the solution of continuity are already separated, and each one is made healthy, then it is necessary that you extract each part of its apparent code until it becomes holy.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with stitching and strengthen them, and on those sprinkle holy dragon's powder and three times, and place over the powder a piece of dialectical plaster, or of some other consolidating plasters, and leave it like that for two days or three, and then remove it and replace it with another plaster and leave it until the wounds are closed, and then cure with an ointment until it is healthy.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of stitching is that you add the solution of continuity or with threads thus as we have recommended in the stitching of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with faith thus as you and I know.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	About the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the divided parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Moist vapors come to some homes in the divided parts of their lips, some apostemes hard similar to fat errors, and some of them are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you convert the lips and divide each of those hardnesses from all parts, and then absorb the umpliscas place with holy trinity until the wounds are restored, and then it is washed with a gentle agreement and the area is cured with water that is stipulated, until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	About the injection of adjusted flesh in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	A great abundance of moist vapors is gathered above the adjusted flesh gum, which the ancient physicians call bulbous, therefore it is necessary that you suspend it with a finger or hold it with forceps and inject it beneath the root, and let the healthy humor flow or the holy blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then stop over the holy trinity place or other stipulated powders or excitatives.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then inject it secondarily, and cauterize it, because then the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	About the root of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the divided parts and of those of the form and between the adjusted gums, there are scours, ulcers, and some moist vapors are blackened and are made citrine or green until the gum is corrupted by that decay and the teeth are ulcerated.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Then you should make the patient sit between your thighs and place their head on your tie, and hold their teeth in those which appear to be the same as the affected areas, and it seems that there is no break from any cause, and that is due to black bile and citrinitat and other internal causes that are not monodified.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	So if it is established that it is in those of the beginning of the reasoning, well; and if not, then you will repeat the reasoning over those on another day and on the second and third until you come to the last statement that you desire.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And you know that the teeth have need of many various forms of roots and of many figures according to how it is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And for that reason the roots of the tooth are those which are rooted in the partition of the teeth, and another root is that which is rubbed between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of roots you should prepare as you will see shortly.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter xxx.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the eradication of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Because you cure the tooth of its pain with all your skill and tardiness in the complete eradication of it, for there is no cause that supplies the void left when it is eradicated, for it is a sublime substance within which excision occurs in the eradication of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Moreover, because the patient is forced to eradicate that tooth, you must be firmly certain what the painful tooth is, for many voids alleviate the pain and convince that it is a healthy tooth, and you eradicate it and then the pain does not cease until the bad and painful tooth is eradicated, for we have not seen this through the operation of the barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.
