Then how can you be certain what the painful tooth is, and what you know to be, then because you scrape in the circuit of the tooth with a spatula in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the tooth to the gingiva of the entire partition, and then you move those threads gently, or subtle forceps at the beginning little by little until that concedes.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then you apply force with strong threads for good loquacious or sturdy stoppage, and pause the head of the patient between your thighs so that you hold them so they do not faint, and then you extract the tooth according to rectitude in a way that does not shake it, nor does the patient experience major pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And then if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments, and place it there in the entire part to facilitate and force the removal of it, so that it is done from the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	Moreover, if the tooth is traumatized or corroded, then because you complete the drawing of that trauma and strengthen those extremities with subtle roots so that it is not trapped at the time of your construction on that root.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And because you operate exceedingly in the scarification of the entire circuit of the gingiva and guard with your strength so that it does not shake and breaks apart from it, and return to the patient for the wickedness that is greater than the primary pain of it.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not do what foolish ignorant barbers do in their obstinacy and audacity over the eradication of them, for they do not administer what we have recommended; because many voids come about on the bad teeth, great difficulties which are more intricate than those that are trapped, and the roots of them all removed, or some of those, or that you extract from the osses of the mandible thus as many voids have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the eradication of it is washed with vinegar in water or agreeable salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if you induce fluxes of blood for that, thus as many voids induce, then you will try a certain quantity of wine and aspersion on the wound, and if it does not confer that wine, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and threads are subtle as those which are faintly moved at the beginning to extract the tooth, with a long handle and short, thick, so that they are not doubled when you must operate.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And thus as many times of thick handle until when you stretch them, they are not doubled, they are short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they are made of Indian iron, decently made of straight extremities, and in the extremities of those are teeth which some enter into others and stretch for strong construction, and some voids in the extremities of those are in the form of a bird's beak, which has the name of cicónia, so it is guarded, and they are of strong construction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter xxvi.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the eradication of teeth and extraction of osses from the trapped mandibles.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to eradicate a tooth that is trapped for some reason, then because you pause on the spot where it is bound for a day or two until the spot becomes mollified; and then you insert the instruments or threads of those which are assembled like the beak of a bird called cicónia or guarded, in the form of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The external remedies of their pain are made from these herbs cum lime or alfalfa.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey this experiment with these forceps or tenaculas, then it is necessary that you operate on the root and dissect all the flesh and introduce the instrument which has an atlas-like name, so it is a small lever of which the shape is like this.
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	It should be a short, thick extremity, and not be bent so that it does not get tired.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if the root is perforated, it is good; and if not, help yourself with other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is a triangular extremity in which there is some thickness.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a more subtle extremity.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you are helped with this instrument having two ramps of which this is the form approaching the following.
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which precede in the scraping of teeth; because it is made with this instrument which is assembled to an eye-sized granule, and this is the form.
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular extremity, curved or short, which has some thickness, and is not bent so that it does not get tired.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing you know is that the instruments for teeth are moved similarly and likewise the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	The skilled craftsmen are wise and subtle in their art, attentive to the mate's second opinion according to what it signifies about the operation and various diseases; because they are among the diseases that the ancients did not diagnose or pause with proper instruments, for the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the bone of the jaw or other bones of the mouth are tired, or if they are weak, then it is necessary to operate on that in its place where it is convenient for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of roots of teeth, and help yourself with gestures of which this is the form.
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should be with some small thickness little by little, and be held or kept in the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone of all is perforated; and then restore the place with convenient medicines according to that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is small weakness in the bone, then scrape that from the weakness and its blackness, and cure it until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of prominent teeth above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the prominent teeth are not according to their natural shape for those, then it is shameful, and especially when it comes to women, and especially to venerable elderly people; therefore it is necessary that you consider: if a tooth is not in proportion to another tooth, and it is not possible to straighten or align it, then root out that one; but if it is attached to another tooth, then you extract it with this instrument of which this is the form; and it is similar to a pig's jaw, and made from Indian iron of extremely sharp extremity.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And it should be your extraction with which you extract it in three days for the durability of the tooth, and that it is not joined to another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth exposed to filing, then file it with a file of Indian iron of which this is the form.
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be all of Indian iron and the edge is sharpened; and it should be with many small points thus like a file in which they are made agitated, in which the tooth is filed little by little in many days with facility, so that no other tooth is joined and falls.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then polish it in the file, and scrape it with a razor's edge.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which one part is tired and hinders the tongue, then it is necessary that you file it until the asperity of that fracture is stopped and smoothed, and it should be applied so that the tongue does not lead or the speech does not corrupt.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of decayed teeth with gold filings or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens to the teeth before concussion and removal by percussion or by fall, and the disease cannot be strengthened on what it affects, and you have treated it with medicinal powders, and your treatment has not been effective, then so that it does not become infected in those that are strengthened with gold filings and not silver, because silver becomes verdigris and is weakened after a few days, but gold at no time is altered.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And it should be the gold in such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the reception is that you take the gold and take its double between two healthy teeth, and then it grows with two tortuosities of the gold between two decayed teeth, or if one or many, until it reaches the web of the healthy tooth from the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then iterate the treatment until the part from which you began, and strengthen your hand with facility and wisdom until it is not decayed.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your constriction is the one that strengthens the veins of the teeth, which do not decay.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then you insert the superfluous roots of the tooth with forceps or tweezers, and add those to each place in gestures, and convert them into occult ones between the healthy tooth and the decayed tooth, so that they do not injure the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	Then you release that thus strengthened with a Roman lock.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	Maybe it is dislocated or broken, strengthen it or them in another tooth in such a manner at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the straightening of two healthy teeth and of two decayed ones, thus as they are bound together at times.
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that one tooth or two return to their place, and are re-implanted thus as they had been recounted, and remain there.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And do not do that unless you are skilled craftsmen and wise.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some remedies are suitable for a cause of the cow's bones, and it is done in their form as a tooth shape, and it is placed in the location where the tooth fails, and it is strengthened thus as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	About the incision of the ligament which you find in the tongue and prohibits speaking.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which you find below the tongue sometimes grows naturally in men, or accidentally and suddenly due to a wound that has already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on him is to open the mouth of the patient, the existing sky in the tie; and elevate the tongue, and then incise those nervous ligaments according to the latitude until the tongue is freed from its retention.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	Maybe in that there is some hardness or induration, and that has been established by consolidation of the wound, then you cut with a lancet and separate it according to the latitude until you have incised the ligament and the induration is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there is not a fracture in the region of the flesh and that you do not cut into an artery or vein, causing a flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then you wash the remains of the incision with warm water or wine, or with warm fresh water; and then you pause below the clean tongue; thus it is customary to hold the patient's tongue below their tongue at any time so that it does not consolidate another wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	Maybe it happens that there is a flow of blood, stop on the vitriolic place thrice; maybe if the blood comes out, then cauterize the place with a gentle cautery that is convenient for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then you cure the other causes until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	About the extraction of a ranula below the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some remedies happen below the tongue, an abscess similar to a small swelling, preventing the tongue from its natural operation; and often it is magnified until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on him is to open the patient's mouth before the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it is of dark color or black, hard, which the patient does not feel sensation, then do not touch that thing that is cancer.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it has declined to whiteness, in which there is humidity, then you put the onguent on him, and incise it with a subtle spatula, and incise it from all parts; and if blood comes out at the time of your operation, then you stop three times above, thus it is vitriolic, until the blood is restrained.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then you return to your work until you have treated it with the complement of him, until it is washed with warm water and salt; and cure that with another cure suitable for this, until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	About the extraction of abscesses from two ears and of those that are nothing in the gullet and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When they occur in the gullet, then they are glands that are assembled together, which happen beforehand and are called two ears, which when you treat them with what we have said in the division and it is not healthy, then you consider if the abscess is hard, of dark color, of little sensation, then do not touch that thing with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for the flow of blood; before you let it mature, and then you can extract it, or it will be broken by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, radish-like, and the root of it is subtle, then that is what needs to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on him is to consider, during your operation, if it has already rested the abscess of him with complete rest or if it has been diminished with some diminution; and then do seize the patient in front of the sun, and his head is in the sky, and open his mouth, and the servant takes between their hands before the tongue of him below with an instrument most noble of which this is the form.
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	It should be made of silver or copper, and be subtle as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then, as you press upon the tongue and show it to him, and touch upon that tie which is beneath, then take nine and place it in the amulet, and pull it towards the divided parts as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that pulls out some cause from the tunics, and then incise it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is assembled with forceps, although the extremities of it are curved, so that the orifice of each one of those is in the interior of the other, very sharp, which is made of iron indeed.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not at your disposal, then incise it with a spatula of which this is the form of it: It should be pointed on one side, not pointed on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have incised one mole, incise the other according to this method of incision, and then apply the incision to the patient's gurgling throat with cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, gurgle with water from the decoction of scorched millet or of myrtle leaves, and similarly to those of the stiping causes until the flow of blood is restrained, and then cure it until it is healthy.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And some vegetables, namely in the gourd of other apostemes, have other golden leaves, and incise them according to what you did and said in the incision of two moles simultaneously.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And you have already medicated a woman with an aposteme which was born in the gourd of it, which aposteme tended to turn dark-colored, with little sensation, which had already closed the gourd of it, and the woman breathed with great straining, and had prohibited eating and drinking water, and was about to die if you hadn't stayed there for a day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the aposteme had so strongly swollen that it had formed two ramps inside which they would issue through two tracts.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then you examine it carefully and place it in one of their corners, and pull it out, and insert it into the large portion, and then you incise it to comprehend the other tract, and then you obstruct its mouth, and comprehend its tongue, and then you place it in that corner of the aposteme.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then you remove a large part of it, and nothing flows from it except a little blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the gourd of that woman is absolutely clear, and she begins to drink water, and then you take a walk, so you didn't cease to incise that aposteme many times for a long time, and the aposteme succeeds in its place, which is prolonged until it is finished.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then you begin to cautery and cauterize the gourd of it, then thus of addition; and then you take a walk, and do not know that God did that miracle, and I myself did it.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 38.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of a hernia when it is apostematized.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the hernia descends to the hollow, and it is apostematized and long, then it is named perpendicular; and if it is in the thick and round part, then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and your cure does not correspond, and sometimes it happens that the aposteme is cauterized because it has stayed subtle, then it is necessary to incise that which is accumulated round; and if it is at that length, and it is bloody, of dark color or black, and it is not in its sentiment, then it is necessary to temper the incision of it, because there is fear about the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you sometimes follow the method that you have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient seize with his tongue an instrument of which the process follows its form, and then place it in the new corner, and pull it out below, and incise it with one of two instruments which are said in the incision of two moles.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And it is necessary that you do not incise it except what is adjusted according to the natural term of its addition, because if you incise it more, you will ruin its natural speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, use that which we have recommended in the incision of two moles, and cure it until it is healthy.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision of it, it is necessary to use skill in the cauterization of it with fear, and the manner of cauterizing it is not only with sharp water, and it is that you place the head of the patient on the tieu seat, and then take the tongue of it with the instrument which we have said, and then take from the water which we have mentioned in the chapter of cauterization, and it corresponds to this living cause, and pause it not sparse nor subtle, and of that fills the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The external application of the cavity where medicine is placed as if it were a conquavitat of a hernia, and place the instrument on the medicine over the womb, and the patient will spit out saliva or mucus from their mouth due to the intrinsic medicine, so that no disturbance occurs on the throat of the patient and that they do not despair because of that cause.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then place your hand on the medicine, and express that over the uvula for a space of half an hour until it becomes disintegrated and settled by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take cotton and wrap it around the extremity of the hernia, and submerge the cotton in the medicine, and insert the hernia into the cotton through a canal until the cotton adheres to it, and do this as many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the hernia, and then leave it alone for three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you indicate that you have tried the medicine, try it again, and then apply the cauterization by removing the cotton from the border, and modify what is in the circuit of the hernia with the medicine, and wash it with cold water, and cure beforehand with embrocation, and remove any bitterness until it is healthy.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of cure is more salvaging than incision and longer in terms of time.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some wounded are cured by the uvula with what is more subtle than cauterization and incision, because it is cured with subfumigation in this manner: take calament, ysop, origan, rue, Arabic scicados, camomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all these causes, or some of them, in a bowl, and let them steep in vinegar and boil; and the bowl should be well-washed with decent water, and placed in a middle location of the bowl, a traverse above which an instrument conquau is placed, made of silver or copper.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And then insert the extremity into the patient's mouth until the vapour reaches the uvula through the tube, so that the uvula is not too obstructed.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then try it on many wounded until it is dry, and be careful that you do not make this cure at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, because it would too much adjust in the abscess, and do not think that you are doing it, but rather declare the abscess of the patient to be cautious.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if the instrument is not present to you, then take a cane and compose it on the extremity of one closed in a hood, so that the patient's mouth is comforted, because the closed hood prevents the vapour from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of spines and of what adheres to the throat and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many wounded adhere to the throat or spine of feet or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you will know that you extract what is apparent, upon which the sight falls, because you take the tongue with an instrument alone in the sun, so that it is declared to you what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is hidden in the throat, you will know that you make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because the cause annexed to the throat will be forgotten through vomiting; or that the patient has eaten a piece of raw turnip or radish or a dry bread; or take a piece of dried seaweed, and tie it strongly with thread, and then translate the patient through this, so that when you perceive the place in which the spines are extracted, then it will be forgotten.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And take an eel and bind it with thread, and place it on the table and let it be extracted; or take a porpoise and let its meat and fat be extracted, and let its entrails be cleansed.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if it is not forgotten through those causes which we have mentioned, then use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it is more gross than a small radius, and in the extremity of the hernia which you insert into its throat with facility.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And elevate the ague to its highest point, and be careful that the touch of the sieve bone of the throat, so that it does not harm the body or what pierces the bone or spine, or what the doctor places on their hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But I think that the patient who inserts it is worse, because of their knowledge of the place of the annexed cause and pierces within, and pulls their hand with the instrument in them, all according to the quantity which is prepared until it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood accumulated in the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When blood is medicated in what we have said in the division of the cure with medicines and not comforts, consider then in the throat of the patient at sunrise, because you have comprehended the tongue of the patient with an instrument which you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you want to extract that small amount of blood or subtly and gently gesture underneath.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's groin area, and place the end of the cannula in the cavity of the ignited iron, and do so many times (until the bloodletting is finished and the patient is freed from the groin area) and abstain from giving the patient any drink for a whole day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a vessel full of cold water, and place the patient's mouth in it, and wash their mouth with that; and do not hesitate for any reason and give them water an hour afterwards, because the bloodletting is almost complete when they feel the water very cold.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	Moreover, if it is not forgotten what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with cumin or aniseed per the instrument that we have recommended in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, for it is four days.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And it is another manner of operation in the fumigation of that, which is to take a pipe on which are ignited coals and the pipe is covered with a covering in the middle of which there is a tube; and then give below the fumigation; and place the patient's mouth at the end of the cannula, and close their mouth so that the fumigation is not forgotten until you know that the fumigation has reached the bloodletting, because the bloodletting will take four days.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not take effect, then you repeat the fumigation many times, and abstain from giving the patient drinks, and eat salty and bitter foods, and do not drink water, and thus it is necessary that this regimen is not forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument with which bloodletting is treated from the groin area when it is visible; and it is similar to forceps, but not because it has some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the groin area, and its end is similar to a beak of a stork, which is hollow, in which there is a small opening, so that, when you grasp something, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon on the perception of abscesses and in section of theirs.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The abscesses are many species, of many manners, according to the memory of theirs, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in perforation and section of theirs through two manners, one of which is for the species of abscesses in their measures; and because of what is comprehended about the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is proper for the places in which accidents of the body occur, because an abscess on the head is different from an abscess on the buttocks; and an abscess in a fleshy place is different from an abscess in a joint; and each one of them has its judgment for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And many abscesses are such that they require not to be perforated but rather maturation of the Sania in those or completion of theirs.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	So other abscesses are those that require to be pierced when they are crossed, and do not mature according to their completion, like abscesses that are close to the joints, because an abscess when it reaches a joint, its essence is prolonged until it pours out what is in its circuit, and strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, so that it makes a cause of contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a main member, and if you delay the perforation of it until it matures, you will harm the main member; or it is near the buttocks, therefore pierce what has not matured; and do not require to pierce crudely, from incomplete digestion, but only that which is near the buttocks, so that you do not pour out its essence and it is elongated to the internal parts of the buttocks, and makes a fistula, or it becomes in the term of it what is not healthy.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You should know the time for piercing the abscess, and thus it is when it matures.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is matured when there is the cessation of pain and the reduction of fever, and also the diminution of redness and of pulsation, and the acuteness of the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because you should know that piercing is done in the place where pus is beneath the abscess and comes out for healing from the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And piercing is always done for the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the hands or feet, and in the place of the tendons, of the cords of the nerves, of the arteries; and, afterwards, in all hollow places where there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	Moreover, when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to delay piercing until digestion of it is confirmed according to its completion, as we have said; because if you pierce it then, it is prolonged the body of the pouring out and much foulness, and strongly endures the lips of it and the profundity of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	Sometimes abscesses are perforated according to the latitude of the flesh or of the body that needs treatment, or according to which member is injured.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer small perforations, and in large abscesses a large and ample or moderate section according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other abscesses are those in which it is necessary that the cord be constricted and enclosed, when it is done thus, and it is done in term that has already been established, thus as that which occurs in troops of dubléc and of buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised in a section having three angles; and of those that are incised thus as the figure of the leaf of myrtle, thus as the abscesses of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those in which a round section is administered and a lunar section, and they resemble those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	Sometimes that which does not have a head thus as are superficial abscesses of the lion, it is necessary to perforate that with a superficial perforation, or only plane alone.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is necessary when the abscess is large and has collected much sania, that you perforate it and do not touch it so as to extract all the pus at that hour; having extracted a part of it, and then place the abscess within another day, and then extract a greater part, and then make those evacuations gradual according to the graduation until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of frail virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or very old and decrepit, because the animal spirit is much resolved in the egress of the sania, and it strengthens the patient, and you open them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	And beware of this chapter with great caution, and then make your perforation in which you perforate these abscesses, so that you abstergescas the wounds and consider thus if the wound of the abscess is small, or is a flat section, then you administer the qualguas of oil or of coto antic; and if the abscess is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then it is necessary that you pause in some traction until they pervenguan ensemps.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord has been cut off or has concaved into the circuit, then it is necessary that you complete it with much coto or thread made from the cloth of oil, thus as when one has treated pans or razizos, their humidity; and strengthen it until the third day; and then proceed to cure it and heal what needs to be healed of the enguentz until it is sanitized.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	Sometimes if there is a flow of blood during the hour of your operation, then you administer cold water and wine in those which mingle with a cloth of oil, and place that over the area of the flow of blood very gradually.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	Sometimes if the flow of blood persists, then it is necessary that you administer a regimen and cure, and powder those which have been recommended in many places of our own book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	Sometimes if it is in winter time, and the place of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then it is necessary that you apply poultices with wine and oil, and pause those over the places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the places are fleshy, then it is necessary that you apply poultices wrapped in water and oil or wine and oil, and all that should be cold until the third day, thus as we have said, and then it is necessary that you dislodge the abscess and abstergescas it and administer in the cure of what is convenient for it to be sanitized.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus it is necessary to know the cure of abscesses universally, sometimes according to the way of distinction already said about each abscess in which manner it is possible to cure it per capita singularly.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	About the section of abscesses which come on the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the cord of the small head abscesses, and it is about species of nodes which contain tunics that are there in fact; and the species of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are pungent, and those that contain humidity resemble a lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those that contain humidity resemble pears, and they are similar to them; and those that are lumpy, are hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of everything, and in the extraction of those that do not have fear, as one must extract those that do not make counter-irritation.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you sprinkle those with an instrument in the form of which you have approached thus, which is called entromes, until you know what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if it contains humidity, then you separate that into sections according to the longitude for a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And it begins in the section of the line of .B. until the line of .G. Therefore, when the humidity is evacuated, then you excoriate that because it contains that humidity, and do not leave any cause of all, because many gradual returns, if it remains from some cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you should immerse the affected area in a warm Egyptian ointment, if it is available, and otherwise, in water and salt; and fill the plague with that which enters into another day, because for that corrodes all so that it removes the roughness of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then you should apply the Egyptian ointment repeatedly to that affected area secondly and thirdly, if it is indicated for him, until you are confident that there will be no roughness due to any cause of that skin; then cure the plague with the ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty knots, then you should cut into that following this method:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	You make a cross-shaped incision in the form of a crown, and cut between the two lips of the incision and scrape out all the affected part, and extract your virtue from the outer layer which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	Maybe if you have made a counter-opening, then do so that you can first reintegrate the primary opening.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, you make an opening in the abscessed area of incision and of cure according to what I have told you; and making an incision over the abscessed area is less troublesome, because it is of little blood and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some veins are so close to these abscesses which are in the head of certain men whose veins are not humid; this causes because you have incised over an abscess on the head of an old woman and touched the abscess thus with a rough, asperous, white, which could not be touched, and if some were about that percussion, it would plague.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	Maybe in other accidental abscesses on the head there is no such capital, thus as with the abscesses that come to the heads of children and deviate from the roots of the ears, maybe the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And stop the perforation of those of the affected part below the skin so that it is alleviated, and the body of the sanity is at the lower affected parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with what is convenient for that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofula which occur on the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Some swollen abscesses occur on the neck and in the axillas and in the armpits; and some swollen ones occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur on the neck, and many that are engendered between them, and all the scrofula of those is within its own proper tunic, and thus as with the nodes and abscesses of the head, thus as I have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofula are many, because some of them are lapidous, and some contain humidity, and some are malignant which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you find with good disposition in the Touching, of which the color of that which is manifest is close to the color of the codena, and it is malleable to all parts, and it is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and it is not pendent, so that you should incise superficially on the upper part of the body under the line of G., until the line of B., and scrape out all parts, and extend two lips of the codena to eleven, or many eleven if you need those, thus as I have said about the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more cautious that the vein or nerve should not be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And it is a space not very narrow, that does not adjust to your hand in incision, or that it irritates the malaute, and that you incise what is not necessary to incise; because if you incised vein or artery and prohibited yourself from your operation, then pause on the veterinary plague treated with ointments or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and strengthen the plague, and lay it there until the acuity of the abscess is repulsed and the plague is mollified and begins to be purulent.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is abstracted.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then investigate whether there is any cause of the other small scrofula, so incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is at the root of the large scrofula vein, then beware that you do not incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Beforehand beware that you do not make that wound double-fold strong and that you leave it until it falls by itself, if it is not annoying.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the plague with old oil which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the entire scrofula, then beware that you adjust the two lips of the plague and cauterize as much as possible so that there is no remaining superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	Sometimes it happens that the abundance of scrofula has overflowed due to its greatness, so you should understand how to insert the root of it, and separate it and administer a suitable treatment.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And in those scrofulous lesions that contain humidity, make a superficial perforation here at the site of maturation, and stop the perforation of what seems to be the pus at the bottom of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then administer perforation, or something similar that seems suitable to those, so that it corrodes what is rotten from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound has been cleaned, then you cure it with suitable generating flesh that grows inward so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	About the section of the pilum of the accidental aposteme that occurs in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients made this section in the epilhot, and we have not seen anyone in our land who has made it like that.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	Sometimes in men there is awkwardness, because the extraction of the epilhot should be avoided, since it would not be done juvenally for as long as all the veins and major parts of the thighs are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	Sometimes in those who have abscesses cut into the mouth or groin or two auricles, when the malady is not in the dog, because they use the section of epilhot to flee from the loss which is made by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, we should insert the epilhot below three circles of the circles of the epilhot, or four with a small section for the latitude in that which is between two circles in quantity, so that the section is in cipher, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for section, because it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of blood that are near.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is inexperienced, then it happens that he extends the cord of the groin to the ankle, and then inserts the cord inward so that it reaches the canal, but avoids the blood vessels if you see any of those causes.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then insert the ciplach according to what we have recommended; and it is significant about the section of the canal for the flux that comes from that exit, which is of the disrupted body and for the abscession of the foot.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And thus the wound remains open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour is renewed in which the perforation is tempered, add two lips of the cord of the wound, and sew only that sole to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make the flesh grow inward so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And thus Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recommended is an exposition that it is not only that you see that some of these apostemes have already operated on the groin of the thigh, and the thigh has come near to death, and its wings are between the thighs, and some go to insert the epiglottis so that the thigh breathes over the site of the wound for some respiration, and it is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for that reason I command to leave the wound open until the evil of the malady is consumed; and it is the evil of it for three days; and then I command thus the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen through my own experiments is that a servant held a knife and put it in the right groin and inserted it into a part of the dog's lung, and I was called to cure it, and I began to touch the pus as it came from the dead, and I discovered the wound and touched the blood which was coming out of the small wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore I must confess that it had not inserted a vein or guided, and the wind came out of the wound, and I cured it until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not accuse the servant if he did not recover in the foot, and then some days returned to the administration of his own dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epilhot there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	About the section on abscesses that occur in the groin beforehand, and it is called hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess named hernia of the groin is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and it is more common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners, because either it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one, there is no need to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two manners of which the one is similar to fatty nodes, and the other manner is similar to an abscess that is made by nodulation of an artery, and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And I do not think that it makes a presumption about him like iron except in the one that is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe that and investigate it with the said method, and if you find it similar to fatty nodes, and it is not suspended in any of the veins, then you insert it thus like the nodes, and extract it from what contains the skin and bursicle; and if not, then all the essence of the being is scrutinized, and then I cure the place with what is necessary for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the section of species of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	The knots have many species and you already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And then I will recommend that you examine the difference between a knot and an excrescence with a dubious surface.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	So you say that an excrescence is a condition of heat and fever and vehement pains until the inflammation of the excess is sedated; and it is a complete putrefaction that stops the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a knot does not have heat or fever or pain, and it contains a certain thick fluid which is like a sac proper to it.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.
