And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a wound and it is made thus as a vacuum, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species, which are either fat or contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, according to what you said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	So then, when you approach the cure of a knot, you expose that one and inquire into its beginning with an instrument called introèmes, according to what will be seen in its form in the chapter which is about to come.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of inquiring into abscesses and all knots, and it is that you take this instrument and insert it into the place where you find humidity which you found in the abscess, and you turn the threads little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated to the core.

And if the current humidity has been forgotten, of whatever color it may be, then you incise on the surface section according to what I said about the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no humidity in the residue of the introèmes, then you know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And cut above it with a cross-sectional form according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	Thus as you are taught, and suspend it with onions, and clear the entire part to facilitate, and keep the skin or sac, if possible, above it and extract that sania from the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract that sania, and many times it happens that way, and then you extract it by pieces until nothing remains of it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if nothing remains of it, little or too much, the knot returns according to its nature.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat. But if the pulse is contrary, or non-pulsating, then you touch and fill the place of the three-part ointment which is veterinary and leave it on for two days or for three until the plague subsides and the inflammation of the wound ceases; and then return to incise that which has been removed from the knot.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of the breasts of men which are similar to those of women.

sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It is of two sharp points long, of sharp extremity thus as spatula; perhaps however it is in some brief smallness little by little, so that in the operation on that it does not pass into the intestine, and that leads to that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of hydropsy is from part of the intestines, because then it is necessary that you section yourself alone at the navel for the quantity of three fingers to the lower parts, in the direction of the navel above the pubic area.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	Perhaps if the generation of hydropsy is due to bad humor of the liver, then your section should be on the left side of the navel for three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	If the generation of it is through the mixture, then your section should be in the right direction.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not cover that your section should be above the rib above which you want to make a massage for that area, so that the superfluities do not flow back to that free place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then perform with the instrument throughout the entire code, and enter into that section, and elevate your hand on the spatula between the code and the siphac, and you extract it; and if the quantity of an ounce or surrounding.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then perform the siphac until it reaches the spatula to the desired place, and that is the place of the evacuation.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then extract it and introduce an instrument whose shape is this:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver canal subtle; it is made of silver or copper or golden alloy, at which in the lower part of it there is a small tube, and on its sides there are three tubes: two on one side and one on the other side; and it is the extremity of the instrument inserted according to the manner of a feather, thus sometimes.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper extremity of it there is a small handle, because when the instrument reaches the water, then that tiny amount descends onto the instrument, thus evacuating the water at the right moment in the proper quantity, because if you evacuate more than that at the wrong time, it will greatly harm the patient by resolving the animal spirit, or it approaches the fifth crisis which is near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	You evacuate it according to the quantity of its virtue and according to what the disposition of the patient's virtue of the pulse and the goodness of the patient indicate to you.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then extract the instrument, and retain the water which causes it, because it is retained so much by the code that retains the tube which is above the siphac, of which I recommend to you that you perform it according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Then try the instrument on another day if the patient tolerates it sometimes, and extract a small quantity of water, and do that for several days on an empty stomach, and beware of error so that you don't leave too much water behind.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient, and leave a large quantity of water, then cure that which is buried in hot sand, and cover it with a cloth, and expose it to the sun for a long time; and cure that with desiccative medicines until it is healthy.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the mixture and the fatigue as you have recounted in that which precedes regarding the extraction of water.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 5.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of children who are born with non-perforated urinary places.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some born children are thus from the womb of their mother and the top of their mixture is not perforated (or the tube is straight or not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Then it is necessary to make a perforation of it as soon as it is born with a very subtle spatula according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then stop in the tube a subtle key of lead and tie it, and you will pass three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when one wants to urinate it remains and hurts; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not stop the lead, already it is possible that the urine which goes over the place will not leave this clarity.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that of which the tube is straight should be medicated with a lead key, thus as we have said, for several days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in which the tube is not in its place, are led astray, because of that, he who is born and the tube is deviated from the end of the virgin head so that it cannot urinate to the divided parts, until it elevates the virgin to its hand to the upper parts; and it is not according to generation, for thus the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a great malady.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation is that the patient is placed on their back, and then extend the head of the virgin to your left hand with vehement extraction, and insert the head of the virgin's head into the place of the perpucii with a sharp spatula, thus as it is inserted like a feather, or you do not touch any part, so that the middle of the virgin appears similar to the head of the virgin and the tube falls into its proper place according to what is necessary.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware that in your operation of blood flow, because many times accidents happen there; and stop at the moment when you absolve the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 6.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	On the treatment of those who suffer in the prepuce at the head of the virgin and of corruption and blackness and adhesion of the prepuce at the head of the virgin.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many born children suffer from this treatment on the virgin and it is an emergence of great flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of those, one is malignant and another is non-malignant.

quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because juvenile cautery is at two opportune moments, namely a flow of blood and the plague when it is corrupted.

And if the head of the penis is corroded and is destroyed entirely at that hour, then you should introduce into the middle of the foreskin a pipe of lead so that the patient may urinate through it.

And if it is difficult to distinguish those exquisite things, then you should scrape with a spatula for some reason of the head of the penis and of the foreskin, and thus it is because the foreskin, when it is subtle, is easily perforated by its subtlety.

Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 47.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the purification of children and the cure of what occurs to those who have been circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution to continuity thus with the other plagues: but we will rather do it with our own operation and will, and those of that sort are properly in children, it is necessary that we assign a better operation and a more gentle path to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, it is said that the ancients did not practice circumcision in any of their free laws, because they did not use it in their writings, and it is only because we have acquired it through experimentation, which causes us to have discovered the majority of artisans and barbers using circumcision and purification with a new and torrid method; and they use ligament with faith and incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And you have already prohibited all these methods and did not discover better purification with forceps, with ligament with faith that in purification with the nail, because many times the code escapes downwards, because the code of the foreskin has two tunics, and one tunic is below, and therefore it is forced to another incision and sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in the purification which is done by alphabetic method, and is digital, which the sabatiers use, the incision of the extremity of the virile member is not assured, because it goes inside the channel of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the nail, therefore you should beware of iron and corrupt your own operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the code of the child is brief by nature, and many times it is seen in such a way that there is no need for purification, and you have already seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But from the purification that is done with forceps and ligaments with faith, goodness, experiment discovers in me, because the forceps are of proportional incision, for which the acuity that is below is thus with the acuity that is above; and therefore as you premise your hand so proportioned to two acuities, and incise accordingly in a single time; and it is made compression of the faith in a figure containing the code of the penis of all parts, in which no error can be found.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you should make the child stay still if it is one of those who understand a little, that you do not do anything but place your faith in its penis only thus, and that you leave it until another day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then you should try to cheer him up in that entire manner which is possible for you to receive his intelligence.

And then you should have him sit between your arms steadfastly prepared, and do not be without caution; and hide the forceps in your hand or place them near the thigh, so that the child does not see those nor any other of the instruments.

And then insert your hand into the patient's groin and feel in the cavity, and pull that inside so that it exits the head of the groove, and then declare what is accumulated there from the patient's dirt.

And then read the marked place with double faith, and then bind below that one little second ligament, and then have your finger placed on the said spot and hold the place of the ligament well below in good retention, and insert it between two ligaments.

La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps is for declaration, this is the shape:

Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 48.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the treatment of retained urine in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio. E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible. And if it is not dissolved in that which we have said, the vehement cause is made above the patient, then it is necessary to administer extraction of it with an instrument called a syringe, of which this is the shape: It should be of silver and its nozzle should be subtle, like a canal of a small bird's feather, subtle in length like a ray of a long palm and half, on which there should be a subtle cane at the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of injection of urine for that is to take the doubled thread and place it in the extremity of the wool or cotton for good liaison; and you insert the extremities of the thread into the part below the syringe, and you insert them with forceps if there is any superfluous cause of the wool, but then introduce it into the canal with vehemence. And then you enounce the syringe at the border and at the album of oil.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient sit on a chair, and envelop the bladder with it and the groove in olive oil and oil of roses.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe to facilitate it so that it reaches the root of the groove; and then double the groove below at the part of the navel; and then you fill the syringe with that; and then you fill it so that it reaches the bladder, and this thing makes the patient be free from the vain cause, and it is not done in this order, but rather the opposite, where it goes to tortuousness.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And gradually stretch out the little finger on the small wool, because the urine dries the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	And extract that and do for the cure of urine, and use a circle, do not cease to make that and use a circle until the bladder and the patient's trouble are alleviated.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 6.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	About the quality of evacuation of the bladder with a clenched hand and similar instruments which are suitable for that.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is an ulceration or abscess in the bladder, or congealed blood in it, or it is constricted by poultice, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then make use of an instrument called a clenched hand, and this is its form.
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but on the outside of it is a tube, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three channels: two from one part, and sometimes also another time.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning it is a concave place, in which is what is swallowed, and it is according to the quantity that oppresses it, until when some cause is withdrawn from the humidity, it is withdrawn, and when it is expelled, with water it is withdrawn, and when it is expelled long, according to what makes the clenched hand phlebotomize in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	So when you want to draw humidity into the bladder, insert the extremity of the clenched hand into the humidity, and withdraw with that water which is swallowed from the above-mentioned parts, because the humidity is withdrawn into the cavity of the clenched hand.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the extremity of the clenched hand into the rod according to what we have recommended in the circle; and then swallow the humidity with that water which swallows, because that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Shape of the subtle crystallizer by which the bladder is crystallized, and this is its shape:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or copper, of which the head is so small that it resembles a little feather, and afterwards the channel is gently bent.

And then take the bladder in motion, and pause in it the humidity that you want to crystallize in the bladder, and then tie it between two strong ligatures with a double thread, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the extremity of the crystallizer into the rod.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then stretch out your hand over the bladder with the humidity in structured descent until the patient feels that the humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder present, then take a piece of parchment and make it into that circle; and perforate it with all its returning flexibility; and then insert a strong thread through those channels, so that they are revolved; and then add the circle so that it is also added to the saffron, because you pause in that water which you want from the humidities, and olives and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that to the instrument and make it so that it is done as it was done in the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 10.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division of the species of stone and its cure with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said about the stone on which surgical operation is done by hand, and sectioning.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I will now present a clear and brief exposition.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	So I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly affects the elderly; and of its signs is that the urine which is excreted from the bladder is like water in its subtlety, and appears in that arena; and the patient feels his rod, and many veins are gathered there, and then it is dressed; and in that water they make a hole in the cul-de-sac of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is a consolation for the health of the children of that until they have reached 14 years; and it is difficult to cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is half-cured because it is among those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that which the stone is larger and the cure is more difficult; And if it is small, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	So when we come to the cure of that, it is necessary at the beginning of that which modifies the patient with a crystallizer which extracts all the filth that is in the two hollow vessels; because that filth some gathered veins prohibits the formation of the stone from the investigation of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then the patient is pressed with the two feet and is constricted and massaged below so that the stone descends to the floor of the bladder, or jumps out of its place through some gathered veins.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that circle between your prepared hands, and the hands of it are afterwards the whisks of it, so that the whole bladder is made to decline towards the below-mentioned parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then thoroughly clean that entire area beforehand.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	So if you feel the stone in the space, then you will touch it at once with a dry cloth over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not feel the entire toe at once, then put oil on the toe indicated by the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the ring finger if they are young and complete, and insert it into the hollow of the knee.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And thoroughly clean the stone until it comes out from the said toe.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually bring that small thing down into the hollow of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press above that on the said toe, and expel it through the parts in front of the place where you feel the dryness.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with their hand; and command another minister to extend their right hand between the genitals, and place their other hand remaining on the codename which is behind the genitals, in the part of the place where the dryness is felt.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert the spatulum between the incident of which this is the shape of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and divide the water that is between the knee and the genitals, not in the middle place, above the left thigh; and let the dryness be on that stone and the said toe, and let it be a transverse dryness, so that the dryness beforehand is wide and strongly stretched according to the quantity that you extract from the stone as much as possible, and no more, because too much compression of the said toe which has the stone would be forgotten, and it would be facilitated by its own deficiency.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And you will know that the stone is somewhere in which it has an angle and margins, because the evacuation of it is made difficult by that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And in that water, it resembles a lens-like stone, and it is round, and it is difficult to evacuate it.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	So if it is the one with angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not forgotten, then you will arrange over that, or you will stretch over that with a decent gesture, the extremity of which is thus like a file on the one you stretch over the stone, and do not avoid it; or you will insert beneath it the subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot reach it, then you will enlarge the tube a little, and if you see a flow of blood, separate it with a glass tristressed with vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is more than one, then at the beginning you will push your hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it over it; and then push a little further into the water; and similarly you would do if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then ignorance is that you insert it with great dryness, because it harms the patient in one of two ways: either it kills or it prevents the continuous distillation of urine, because the place is not completely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it from within until it is forgotten, or insert into the fracture of it with the forceps until it extracts that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	So when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with enemas of aloe and dragon's blood, and stretch it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And put on that wounded area an infusion of oil and wine, or oil rosated and cold water, so that the post-wound caution may be cooled.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then rest the patient on their back, and do not disturb the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that is disturbed, moisten the place with water and much oil, and then heal it with a gentle icon and a gentle bazilicon until it is healthy.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound apostema causes bad ulcers, and it is adjusted and corroded, and it seems thus as if the blood is congealed in the bladder, and therefore the urine is prohibited (and this is known through the egress of the blood with the urine), then insert the said toe into the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains it will provoke the bladder to corrupt and putrefy.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and apply an opposite to all species, with what is convenient for it in terms of cure until it is healthy.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And see to it during all the hours of the entire cure that you read and adjust the medicines which are placed on the spot.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and it is in the meat of the bladder, and it is fixed in it, and the urine is prohibited, then cure it with what you recommend beforehand, because many vegetables are useful for this cure and are accused of dryness; and already you have spread it, and it is that you take a perforator of iron alloy, of which this is the shape of it:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extraction, pointed, fixed in a fist.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And take hold of the vein, and place it in that position on the rock so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And insert the iron into the vein, making a perforation so that the perforator goes to that rock.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the perforator with your hand on that small rock little by little, and you will make the perforation of it so that the other part can penetrate; because the urine is almost absorbed.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And place your hand on that which is rough from the rock of the affected part before the vein, because it is bruised, and it is ulcerated in the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	Maybe this cure is not adapted to you for some cause that prohibits it, then place a vein beneath the rock, and another vein above the rock.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And enclose the rock in that vein between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And extract that one.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And dislodge the ligament and clarify the congealed blood, which is done in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to ligate the vein beneath the rock, but so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligature above, because when the vein is dislodged, the channel of the rock returns to its place and closes the wound.

And for this reason it is necessary to ligate the vein above, so that you elevate the channel to the upper parts, or it returns to its own complete complement, and closes the wound thus, as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 16.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	Maybe you see a stone in some of those, then the cure of it is difficult, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman's foot is veined.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is because you do not find a woman who knows how to describe the measurements of the doctor when it is cast, or they are of the married women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is because you have not found a woman who knows this art, especially the operation with my hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the section on stone in women is far from the place of the stone, because it requires a deep incision, and there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	Maybe you need to provoke you to that, then it behoves that you take a wise woman who knows how to extract, and few are skillful.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	Maybe you are deprived of that, then seek a wise and subtle woman who is experienced in the practice of women, or presents a mature woman who has knowledge in this art, or a woman who has a share of the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Then make that present, and command it to do all that you will order, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; which cause is that you examine if the woman is veined, then it behoves that you put your finger in her vagina and seek the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Then if you find it, extract it beneath your finger, and then command it to insert above it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	Maybe if it is not veined, then command the matron to insert her finger in the conch of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she places her left hand on the bladder, and comprehends it with good comprehension.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Then if you find it, then it behoves that you gradually draw it away from the orifice of the bladder to the lower parts with your hand in a semicircle until you perceive it at the root of the thigh.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert upon that supposition of the magnitude of the conch to the root of the thigh of whichever part is at its boundary and sent the stone in that part, and the finger of it is not removed from the stone extracted beneath it.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section is little at the beginning; and then insert the radius above that section, and if you feel the stone, then adjust in section according to the quantity which you know that the stone will be extracted from it.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And you know that the species of stone are many: because among them is small and large, and rough and smooth, and long and round, and having ridges.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Then you know how many species are of it for that which you signify about what you want.

And if you see a flow of blood, adjust at the vitreous place three times and hold it for an hour until the blood is absorbed, and then return to your operation until the stone is ulcerated.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And make that you prepare with the instruments which are said in the extraction of stone in men, so that they will be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and you know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is inserted, then you stop powder on the place and strengthen that with pulvils and strict descent, and do not iterate that; and leave the stone and do not extract it, because soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then heal the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	So when the sharpness of the blood is calmed down, then put on warm wraps, and at that place you will return to your operation until the pain is forgotten.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	About the section on hernia and cough.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia is not but an accumulation of humidity in the white membrane which is below the codena of the genitals containing the fluid, and it is named membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some fat women are in their own natural preparation of the fluid in the partition of the fluid, until it is known that it is another fluid; and it is the codena of the genitals between the white membrane which we have mentioned, and it is not that but bitter.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness which afflicts the genitals, because for those it is fundumental matter, and some old women are afflicted by percussion or a blow on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity has many colors, because the color of it is declining to citrine or bloody, or red, or it is black and foul, or it is whitish and pale, and that is what is worst.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known are these: because if it is in the white membrane which we have mentioned, then the abscess is red and declining a little in length, thus forming the figure of fluid, and it appears in the genitals, because the humidity contains all this from every part.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in its own natural partition, then the abscess is red in the partition of the fluid and thus one estimates that it is another fluid.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the codena of the genitals and the white membrane, then you will find it below the sentiment.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you want to know the color of the humidity, then you will spread the color of the humidity in the abscess within the entrails of the patient whose form is preceded; and according to what has been said in the vestige of the entrails, judge from that which has been defined.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	So when we come to the cure of the iron wound, then it is fitting that we command the patient to be flebotomized if it is possible for you, and sometimes the cost of the patient.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then place a suppository on each of the two seats above some cause a little higher, and pause below the word drops.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then place you on the left side of it, and command the minister to follow on the right side of it, which extends its verge to one of two layers at the codena of the genitals and at the partition of the miracle of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a wide spatula and separate the codena of the genitals from my middle place for the length until you reach the pentagonal.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And make a section according to the rectified engagement distant from the line that divides the skin of the genitals, until you reach the white membrane comprehending.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And excavate that, and observe, and guard yourself so that you do not incise that; and your excavation is the one that excavates for partition thus far as it is suspended in the worst fluid and subtly scrutinized in the excavation according to the quantity at your possibility.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the full membrane of water in a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two labia of the section with uncials, and extend the membrane to the upper parts; and do not touch the codena of the genitals comprehending, and incise the membrane in that manner which is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And incise that in its entirety or in pieces, and majorly widen the seat subtly, because if you do not scrutinize the incision of it exquisitely, it is not made securely so that the water does not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the fluid proceeds from that defect of its membrane at the time of your operation, then when you have completed the section of the membrane, return to define that, and then adjust the two labia of the codena of the genitals with a suture, and then heal that as well as the other wounds, until it is sanctified.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the fluid corrupted by another bad mixture, then it is fitting that you lift the vessels which are above the suspenders, and extract the fluid, and then heal that as well as we have mentioned.

But if the water is accumulated in two separate parts, then you know that the two are hernias; therefore incise that part according to what has been done in the other engagement; and if it is at your sight that it is an operation, then you do it.

e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	And you should press two cloths and fill in the lanolin ointment according to this similarity; and fill in the extremities with those that are previously treated with cotton or lanolin humid, and add structure to the breeches of the breeches, and one extremity takes hold of the backside into the buttocks, and the second takes hold of the parting of the perineum, and two extremities over two thighs here and two extremities over two ankles, and the entire structure is adjusted in the breeches of the breeches.

e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is assembled into a Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then pierce the ciphac, and it is ignited until all humidity is driven out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the ciphac to inches, and scrape in inches, and scrape with a subtly ignited cautery; and insert it according to what is possible for you until you eradicate all of it; and beware of the fire that it does not touch.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is more salvaging and longer-lasting than the flow of blood, and better than an operation with sectioning.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	Perhaps you have made a contrary apostema in the hour of sectioning or in the hour of cautery, or flow of blood, then it is necessary that you cure which contrariety you make for yourself, with a curative treatment that convenes to him according to what is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	Perhaps the patient is poor, and does not hope for the second operation due to its horror, then administer perforation according to what you have recommended here; and it is when it is certified by you, because of what we have said about the signs, that this hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then it is necessary that you elevate the patient on some elevated seat, and then pierce the apostema in the lower part of the body with a spatulum lat, and pause the perforation according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let it be a wide perception until all the water is drained out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then pause over the cold spot and lift it there, so that the remaining water drains out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then cure it until the wound is healed.

Perhaps the contrariety is at the urgency of the water in that hour you pierce it: and this is not done except to quarrel with the white pannicol in the orrifice of the wound, which makes contrariety and prohibits the exit of the water; then it is necessary that you put in the wound a penal instrument or one which extracts the water from the hydropits, in the form which precedes; or adjust on the opposite side of the wound a small one.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns, and it is augmented for six months or in those environs; and when it is augmented, then it should be pierced according to that method of manipulation, because the patient will thus pass the seven days.

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	On sectioning about fleshy hernia and its cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the sectioning about this hernia, there is a persistent fear of losing a limb in the major dispositions; because to me it has been seen the dismissal of it and being saved by that better one.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you are reminded of the operation on those and the species of the apostemas.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that the apostemas are born in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and it is done for many causes: or for an acute sharp inflammation, which is poured out to the genitals, or for percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And it is the color of the apostema according to the color of the body, and it does not appear in the pain, and it is a heavy apostema.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And I have seen an apostema lapificada, of which the color is dark, and it does not feel pain.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And some hernias are made for swelling of the arteries, and for inflammation of those as well which I have perceived the remembrance of it, or for inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	Perhaps that which is for inflammation of arteries is recognized by the dispersion of the apostema when it comprehends those in the tender fingers; and it does not touch that.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	Perhaps that which is made for inflammation of a vein is not dispersed from it by any cause, unless the compression is in the fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that about this species a section is made and about the other carnals; and it is that you insert the code of the genitals, and then stop the fire at the upper parts, and extract that from the white ciphac, and deliver the suspenders of the veins, and tie them, and insert the suspenders so that you deliver that from all parts of the fire.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if you have already consolidated those injured limbs, then it is necessary that you extract the patient and insert them into a warm place.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if it is adhesion between some part of the hip, or between that which is between the pelvis, then it is necessary that you release all that adhesion and insert it for round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	Maybe it is a birth of flesh in the place of adhesion which is behind, then it is necessary that you insert all that is of it, and extract the patient thus as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then when your operation is complete, fill the wound with lanolin ointment and rose oil; and then take care to heal that wound with another cure until it is healthy.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter 64.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	On the treatment of hernia that occurs in childhood.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	It is an abscess enveloped by some similar enveloping like a tumor with mollification of the testicles, and it is made difficult to exercise movement and walking on the affected limb.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the treatment of this illness, it is by fear for that which is preceded by remembrance.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, it is necessary to say that I will operate according to what the first authorities did.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that it is necessary to place the affected limb on an elevated stool; and then apply padding to the suspensors of the testicles at the lower parts; and then you will hold the codena of the genitals with the ties that are tied to the pelvis, which are probable to be in a virgin state; and you have those other ministers who are assisting you, and extend them with vehement extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then insert a spatula to separate the agglutinated part by making a transverse section in the right of the veins, until the veins are discovered.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then scrape out the entire affected part thus as you have said in extracting the roots of the arteries which are in the temples.

And then insert them in the middle place for right section according to the length of the body, and extract what is added to the fetid and corrupt humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then heal the wound with a cure of other wounds in which you want to be healed, so that the veins, which are not nourished by one of the two genitals, may not become bad for that.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	Maybe it thrives in all the pelvis, then it is necessary that the testicles are extracted or that the testicles for that are separated from the veins, so that they are deprived of all nourishment for the incision of the veins, and that they are stabilized, or that it is separated for that so it does not grow youthful in those.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter 65.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	On the treatment of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The occurrence of this hernia is by section that ends in the extended hip over the belly on the part of the angles of the miracle of the belly, so that by giving way to the intestines of that rupture, it adds to the intestines.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the hip or of exhaustion of it, and it occurs in these two species for many causes: either by percussion, or by fall, or by shouting, or by elevation of some heavy cause, or by similarity.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of that, when it is by extension of the hip, is that it occurs little by little over a long time, and does not occur suddenly, and it is an abscess gathered within until you feel the pain, so that the hip compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of it is when it is by section of the hip, because at the beginning it causes vehement pain suddenly; and it is an abscess appearing below the fallen codena, and that is by swelling of the intestine, and the body of it is in the parts before the hip.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And some veins are forgotten in the intestine, and this intestinal hernia is called zigibal.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And some veins are made in the ventosity, and some veins run into the intestine's end, and here it is retained, and it is with great pertinacity of the illness, and some veins make evil pain and major worsening when it is premature.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the treatment of the species of this illness iron is used, for it is necessary that the cauterization be avoided in that.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of the operation of that is to command the patient to reduce the intestine with their hand at the lower parts of its cavity if it obeys the usual return, and then it is invested over the column between the two hands, and raises the legs of it.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then stop the codena which is the codena of the testicles at the lower parts, and insert the entire codena of the testicles for the length; and then place it in two labia of the section uncis according to what is necessary to close the section with those.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if you section according to the quantity that it is possible for you to do, then from that the man may be restored.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	Then scrape off that crust which you have on the vertebrae of the back, until the white crust is discovered from a certain part.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	When you insert the finger into that which is the vertebra, in that which is between white crust, which is on the back of the man, and between the crust according to, and absorb with that adhesion which is in the part behind the man.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then move the hand on the back of the vertebrae to the fore parts, and also extend the white crust with your left hand, and elevate the man to the crust at the part of the section; and command the minister to extend the man thus and you dissolve the adhesion which is behind in a complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And search with your fingers to see if there is no cause of the intestine wrapped in the white crust.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find some cause, then you inject that into the belly below.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle in which there are twelve threads, and insert it behind the crust, which is on the back of the vertebrae, which is the section; and then insert the extremities which emerge from the thread until there are four threads, and then compose some knots over each figure in the manner of a cross; and tie that crust about which we have said that it is on the back of the vertebrae with strong ligament of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then envelop the extremities of the threads and tie them with violent ligament until some of the vessels that you have touched do not transmit any cause, so that from here on, an abscess does not form.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another ligature according to the first ligature, a distance of three fingers; and then apply two ligatures below the crust which is on the back of the vertebrae, in the quantity of the greatness of the finger, and insert all the remaining part roundly, and remove from there the man.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then insert into the part below the back of the vertebrae for sectioning of that which flows pure and healthy blood, just as we have recommended in what we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer the submerged lancet in oil, and pause in the plague; and administer the ligature which we have recommended (and some crusts of white crust are cauterized, which we have said, then the insertion of the tempestuous flux of blood, because many times it happens) and release the ligature until it falls by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the healing of the wound is delayed, then warm water should be poured over it, and pause on that until it falls according to what we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the wound with another cure of wounds until it is healthy.

De hernia ventosa.	Of windy hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, nothing is seen that has been hardened under the cure of iron with him.

Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter 67.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the dislocation that is done in the joints.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Some times it happens to rupture in the joints thus as we have said, and emerge from the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And they do not assign any cause of the intestines to the genitals; and if they do, it is little; and it returns in all hours.

But if the time is prolonged in that, it is adjusted fissure in the crust until the intestine descends into the crust; and it happens thus for the extension of the crust which is in the joints as we have said, which causes because the crust is extended, and then it is mollified and the place becomes abscessed and emerges.

And sometimes it is cured with iron according to this method: and it is that the patient lies on his back between his two hands, and then cut the place of the rupture of the abscesses emerges in section for the latitude according to the quantity of three fingers.

E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the extremity of the rod, and do not insert anything into the crust at all, nor extend the man, nor any other cause thus as you will know in the cure of intestinal hernia.

And then you should treat that wound with the cure of wounds, and when you incise the abscesses, clarify and restore the wounded area until it is consolidated; because the scar is contrary and not adjusted to the prominence of rupture.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	The cautery is better in this place, for it is more suitable for health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter 68.

The cod (testicles) of some men is softened in certain ways because it is softened by the fat that is between them, and it is affected by their attention.
