Capitol .lxix.	Chapter 69.
De castracio.	About Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	You know that castration is forbidden in our law, but I was led to remember it in this book; and there is no need for remembrance of it except for two reasons, one of which is that it should be in the science of the doctor when he is expert in that, who knows the cure of it when it occurs; and the other reason is that we sometimes have need of castration of other beasts to improve our livestock, like mules, and oxen, and pigs, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition or by sectioning the seed.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	Moreover in that which is done by attrition, the method of operation is that we make the beast drink hot water until its genitals are softened and loosened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	And then take those with your hand into the earth until they are dissolved and do not appear to be there anymore.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	Moreover in castration done by sectioning and cutting, it is necessary that you hold the beast and press the cord of its testicles to the left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	And then tie the suspensors, and incise above each testicle in one section until two testicles are separated.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then incise those parts so that you can extract some excrement.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave any cause on those of the scar, but rather the subtle scar which is above the veins.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And this method of castration is better than that which is done by attrition, because attrition strongly leaves some cause on the testicles so that the beast desires to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then heal the wound until it is healthy.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter 70.
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	About the cure of Hermaphrodism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphrodism in men is according to two ways: one is because it appears in that which is in the space of the testicles, in which there is a figure like a female's womb in which they are felt.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And some veins come out from that cord which is in the testicles.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	Moreover, in women it is a species: and it is that the womb of the woman above the perineum is similar to two testicles of a man, a little smaller in all its miniatures, with a partition before, similar to the perineum of a man and two testicles.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the cure is of three species: two from men and one species from women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	And it is necessary that you incise those adjusted flesh until it evacuates the impression of that, and then you cure those with the cure of other wounds.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second species of men from which urine comes out, which is in the cord of the testicles, there is no cure or operation for it.

De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	About Abortion and Eminent Flesh caused by Women.

Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alratica.	On the treatment of gout.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Gout is when the knee of the woman is not perforated, or the small passage.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental is due to bad alignment which has preceded, and that is done or for flesh not well adjusted or for subtle or excessive effort.

E es que pauses sobre las doas labias pulvils, e aprop pausa les tieus ditz indicz de amdoas las mas encemps.	And it is that which presses on the two pubic lips, and then you pause with the fingers indicating to amend both the more inward parts.

Mays si la oppilacio es per carnada, lahoras suspen aquela am unci, e inscideys aquela.	But if the obstruction is due to fleshiness, then suspend that in an onion, and inject that.
E sian am tu las medicinas que fan cessar flux de sanc ses mordicacio, ayssi cum ahacatia, e sanc de drago, e enses, ajustat am album de huou.	And here are the medicines that stop the flow of bloody wounds, such as achaetia, and dragon's blood, and others, adjusted to the white album of urine.

E tengua aquela per alcus jorns e aministra calgua de li sec.	And hold that for several days and administer lukewarm water to the sick person.

Capitol .lxxiii.	Chapter 23.

E aprop pulveriza sobre aquelas deves le fluxs del sanc de una de las polveras insciscivas ses mordicacio, ayssi cum acassia e semblant ad aquels.	And then powder over those from which the flow of blood of one of the powders injected into the wounds stops, thus with cassia and similar to those.

And then take an ointment and submerge it in the juice of colyander or the juice of arnaglaza or the juice of guarrievier with wine pentit, and make adhere to the spot; and then cure the spot with an unguent until it is healed.
Mays athyl rog le qual es de aspre reguardament, cove que tu inscidas aquo que a tu appar de aquel segon que he dit en theyl engualment.	But the royal rule which is of rough observation, it is necessary that you inject that which appears to you according to what I have said in the royal engagement.
E cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxiv.	Chapter 24.
De perforacio de eyssedura accident en la mayre.	On the perforation of accidental hernia in the belly.
Motas specias de apostemas accideysso en la mayre, ayssi cum cranc e apostema lapident e ulceracios e adhubelat e erpetromens e fistulas emorroyas e raguarrias e thyl e autres apostemas.	Many species of apostemes fall into the belly, such as cancer and lapident aposteme and ulcers and adherent and erpetromenes and fistulous hemorrhoids and raguaries and thyl and other apostemes.

Then I will cover how you should consider if the pain of the abscess in its beginning is acute with percussion and fluctuation and fever, and sometimes it becomes red and swollen, and then you don't touch it with perforation, and cure it with what helps on the maturation until the acuteness of the accidents ceases.

And I will cover when you want to administer this instrument that you place in the radius of the matrix of the woman's womb, and what part of the instrument enters the matrix should not be more than the radius of the womb and leads to the disease.

E pause deforo la mayre e sobre le pentenilh lana munda submersa en aygua en la qual sian bulidas malvas.	And place a form before the womb and on the perineal wound a clean membrane submerged in water, in which there are swollen veins.

A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach midwives how to deliver babies that are badly positioned, which require medical treatment when they do not come out naturally according to figure.

De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	On the extraction of the dead fetus.

Perhaps the atrocious fistula does not penetrate, then make it penetrate in some way you are prepared, but not much in the groin, because it is not for you to do that so as not to incise the vessel; and then make it enter until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The form of the spine-like spatulum is what has been found for the fistula: the curvature of which is very acute and the other part is not acute, so that it does not incise anything that is not necessary, thus sometimes.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of stitching of hemorrhoids in which the blood flows into the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are thus according to two methods, because either they are between the rectum resembling thus that it is of carbon, or those are like a layer of rough skin.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And of those are small and large, and the blood flows from those sometimes and it is one, and thus many, and thus outside the rectum, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	Perhaps those that are outside the rectum are thus according to the measures of little humidity, from which flow yellowish water or a small amount of blood with continuous flux, and thus according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure of that which is dentated in the rectum is that you command the patient to sit and to exert themselves until the rectum becomes dry and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take hold of them and suspend them in air with an uncle or have someone hold your finger, and then insert the veins into their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	Perhaps the uncles are not held by them due to the humidity and softening of them, then take them in dry, rough or woolen cloths, and extract them into the tender threads, and then insert them and powder over their hollow cavities with powders blown onto them for cauterization; or cauterize them according to what is written in the chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then heal them with another cure until they are completely healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey the evacuation, then insert the suppository into the anus in the place where it is most constricted, and wash it with that water which is in the vessel and which helps to evacuate more easily when the patient strains.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	Perhaps the hemorrhoids are before the anus, then the cause of them is easier, and it is that you take them with your finger, or take them with an uncle, and insert them, and then heal them with water which we have said until they are completely healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And in the one who has an incision, you should administer sutures according to this method: take a thread enveloped and insert it into the needle and then extract the hemorrhoids from the above parts, and make it penetrate through the needle into the root of the other part, and envelop the two extreme ends of the thread around the part below the needle, and so latitudinally; and strengthen the hemorrhoid in a strong structure, and then cut the thread and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And make a totality of them, and let one of them be the one that does not hurt, so that the superfluity of the blood flow runs from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then pause on the anus, wrapped in oil or cerate; and place it on the anus and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then let that be until it forms a scab; and when it falls off, heal them with an unguent or another cure until they are healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the cure of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Soft words given hastily for the excision of a wound or for the constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are antiquated and of no value in that medicine, then it is necessary to remove them from the point of the spatula or with your finger until they are humid and held back by the escar, which prohibits their consolidation; and then heal them until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you remove them with a vigorous scraping because the first intention is to let the blood flow and they are excavated; and then heal them until they are completely healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	On the cure of gout, that is clear.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that gout, that is clear, and it's not if you don't notice the redness according to the color of the body resembling a head of garlic, and it is made in the whole body and mainly in the parts below the feet and fingers, and it ends for those who have the annoyance.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it is necessary that it be incised where it is in the course of the vein, and held with forceps or an uncle, and eradicated from its root; and then heal it.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you want, cauterize the second thing that is written in the following chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	Perhaps a wart is a small, rough, rounded fistula on the surface of the body, and many soft words come from the mouths of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure of it is to extend and insert it, or to strengthen it with a thread or a hair until it forms a scab.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize it, according to what we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And already eradicated are the inward and outward ones with the instrument which you will direct.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	Perhaps a mole is a small, rough, or fistulous growth on the surface of the body near the knee, and when it breaks out, it seems to be in the likeness of the formation of a mole, and it is made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure of it is to take a needle of hawk's beak or vulture's beak, and make it strong, and place it on the mole until it contains the circle of the needle around the parts of it; and then revolve your hand with the needle until you insert what is in the course of the mole, and pause it in the flesh of the skin, and eradicate the mole from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make it with a needle of iron or of steel according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The part below the needle should be subtle, solid (not perforated), enveloped so that above the said part the apprehension of it is abolished and the revolution of it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want, cauterize the mole according to what is previously said in the cauterization of atheyl in the chapter on cauterizing.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the manner of instruments that are administered to give comfort.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some comforters are made of silver or copper or tin foundry or alloyed; and some comforters are made of those small and large instruments according to what is administered, because that which is administered for the care of small children should be small; and of those whose buttocks are fragile or delicate, the comforters of those are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and few comforters:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The top of the tube that is below, in which the bag is tied, should be wide according to this method; and it should be distinct at the point where the bag is tied, like many times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of the tube that is inserted into the anus, which is smooth (not rough) like a lion, subtly introducing; and on one side of the tube there are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel should be according to the size of the roots and the anus, even if it's small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag in which the medicines of bladder of beast or of sheep's skin are placed, and its length should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And let it be pierced for many channels, just as it is revolving; and if the space that is between the channels is large enough for the finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those channels a strong thread of crude thread which is of ten threads, or around them; and adjust it to the bag; and when it is placed in it, let it be tightened at the top of the comforter between two distinct constrictions, and then comfortize each channel: The quality of comforting is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then let the patient be placed on their back, and elevate their legs up high and place one cord above them on which there are holes or a lancet; and apply the extremity of the cautery with oil or album of water or mucilage of fenugrec or similar; and then insert that into the anus to facilitate, and let the minister take the bag and extract it twice or three times with vehemence until it is evacuated from the intestine as much as is in the comforter; and then remove the comforter and the patient raises their legs against the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces out that evacuation, hold it as much as you can; and if he sleeps for an entire night, it is better to delay the treatment.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	Better if you comfort them in the illnesses of solution of belly and evacuation of the intestine, then you iterate the cautery until it is healthy.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are hemorrhoids or painful abscesses, then let the comforter be subtle and gentle, among the comforters which children are usually comforted with.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the treatment of wounds what is convenient to the book, and I will say thus the treatment of those with mother and medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, I say that wounds are diversified according to what and where they are made, and according to the location on which they occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes why many wounds are made thus are from getting hurt by a stone, or incision of space, or cutting with a knife, or percussion with a lance, or with a fist, or with an arrow, or similar to those many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Better the wounds that are on the parts of the body thus are from a wound which falls on the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the belly, or the thighs, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the treatment of some wounds because it pauses that reasoning and rule about the other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I begin with simple head wounds, because the remembrance of the composed chapters will come to the beginning of the third capital chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, I say that when there is a simple head wound and it's not a fracture, then consider: if it's from getting hurt by a stone or similar, and already has wounded the scalp so much alone and it's a great wound and fears about that patient having an abscessed apostema, then you should quickly treat the cephalic wound, and don't delay; and extract from the blood according to the quantity of the virtue of the blood if there is no prohibiting cause for phlebotomy, especially if the blood that is extracted from the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let there be phlebotomy of the contrary part of the wounded area; and beware of the patient's relapse and of vicious and gross vices.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	Better if from the minute you prohibit some cause, then let it be diminished of the vice and not approach to flesh nor to vice.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause on the wound, if it has abscessed apostema, cut into oil rose solutives or in wine in which it is stipulated.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	More often it is certain to make an incision on the affected area, then pause over the wound, if it has recently bled and the air has not yet changed the powder that you will recommend applying little by little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed it, then pause on the healing wounds until they are healthy.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	More often if the wound is large or is due to a spacious and similar incision, and the lips of it are not adjusted for pustules, then adjust them with a suture according to what you recommend for their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	More often if the wound has exposed bone and flesh, and it is not retained by them except for a small suspensor, then incise there and treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh properly in place of cartilage, and command the patient to abstain from nourishment in which there is grossness: cabbage and fermented foods are similar to their composition, until they are well-compounded.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find decay and rot in the cartilage and it does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that rottenness and remove it, and treat it properly.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	More often if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which flows a lot of blood that can be harmful, and it is not absolved by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find it unincised, then you incise it with a spatula, or ligate it; and if necessary, you provoke what we have said does not concur, then you cauterize until the blood is absolved.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is lighter; indeed you dust over those wounds with that powder, because consolidated, so that the air does not change them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of iris one part, dragon's blood two parts, and extinct earth three parts; let it all be well-triturated and crumbled, and fill the wound with it, and let it be constricted by a good bandage until it stays on that affected area, and let it coagulate with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And you strengthen it from beneath with pillows and lift it up, and do not disturb it while it is like that, because it is not incised, for it is not eradicated by the medicine until it is healthy.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes it happens that this alone is sufficient, when you do not have iris and dragon's blood present.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And now this medical operation is suitable for large wounds when it is convenient to pause over them and they are stretched, and the recent wounds with their own blood, which the air has not yet altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is summer time, then you do not attend to the position of this powder, but rather take care of those wounds with what we have said, indeed you pause over those healing wounds with digestive powders, or you pause over those poultices made from flour of ordinary bread with water and honey until they get purulent; and you treat them with another cure until they are healthy.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	More often if it happens to the wound fractured in bone, and it is small, then you extract that with gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And you will direct the cure of fractures of the head in what is coming next.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	More often if the wound happens on the neck, then it is not in difference in medication, and between the wound of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	More often if the nerves of the neck are incised or arteries, then if they are nerves, it is not in their origin but rather evaded cure with what makes vehement stipulation, indeed as we have said and written that it is veterinary and similar to their composition, because it does not harm the nerves and contradicts that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And you do not pause over the wound for any total cause of complete numbness, because the substance of the nerves is numb and their continuity with it is in the brain, which is the pus that is above all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that which is cured by gentle medicines, indeed as it is caused by washing with double water, some veiled infusion in rose oil or non-rose oil, and thyme when it is washed with double water and the other minor pains are diminished according to this manner, and healing humors.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	More often if the wound is large, then administer suture, or bind the lips of it, and treat it with pillows until it is healthy.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	More often if the wound is deep or happens to it at the lowest part of the pus, then you pierce that in the place most pressed upon.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	More often if in the wound an artery is incised and a flow of blood is obtained, then separate or ligate it, or cauterize it if necessary to provoke what we have said.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	More often if you have incised the vertebrae of the throat or all, and thus saved the veins of the neck, then you adjust the lips of the cartilage with a suture on the cane of the throat and do not touch that; afterwards equalize it and reduce it to its natural figure, and strengthen it with decent structure, and lift it up for some days; and treat it with healing humors in which there is stipulation and excitement until it is healthy.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	When the plague is in the bone and makes an impression, then perceive it thus, and if there are fragments of it in him, extract all that you can from there; and what you have not perceived, let it enter into the part where the plague will be relieved, and separate it from the severity of his pain.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then dust over that area with the powder which you have recommended.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the plague is a festering wound, then cure it with that water of which the remedy will come to you in the seventh chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the sores of the neck or of similar ones that are made between the spine and are made in the scapula or in the cotyle or in the lance or in similar ones.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of the lance or of the cotyle, and you measure its depth, then consider that if the plague has reached the vitals when the patient's condition worsens; then know that the plague is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the plague is recent in the seventh vein, then you pause at the first hour's powder, and do not strenuous that which is not retained in the depth of it and returns to the heart and alleviates the patient, rather pause on the attractive retention, and remove those two veins a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the retention is not present to you, then pause at the orifice of the plague, which is very close so that it sucks out what is of the humors; and make that the patient sleeps on the plague so that it flows out what is in him, adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the plague has passed three days or more and does not affect the patient with spasm or tremor of bad heart nor constriction of wings, and he has good other dispositions, then know that the plague is saved; and therefore cure it with warm baths and another entire cure until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of it is excessive, and already all time is opened, then know that already a festering wound has been made; therefore cure it according to the seventh chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is from incision of the scapula or of the cotyle, and is simple on the surface of the foot or back, then cure it with water that is preceded by suturing, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If it has made an impression in the bone, and its roots are fixed, then twist the plague and gather to extract those roots, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then let them enter so that the plague will be relieved, for their extraction from there is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other plagues that occur in the other limbs, the juvenation in cure is the juvenation of what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the plagues of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that affects the belly is either great, or small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Some great evacuations come from the intestine or nerves of the intestine, because it is made an introjection of them and their suture must be more vigorous and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and thus it is that the reduction of them is more difficult, if you do not take care of their introjection at the seventh place, because it will be opened and becomes gross due to the instrument of it being made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the moderate disruption is better, because in that case it is not difficult to reduce the intestine, just as it is difficult in the two species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common that convene in sutures of the other plagues of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other proper sutures communicate with the other plagues, but above all there are own proper ones in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each one with exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Then I say that when the plague is small and there is some cause of the intestine for that, and it is made difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two manners: either by smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the intestine has received inflammation from the frigidity of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is so, then it is necessary that you scale it thus, that you submerge a sponge or cloth humid in warm water alone, or that you cook in water squinant, and cypress, and spice, and embrocations with that in the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And some evacuations make it go in which has been stipulated, and it is better than water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation being resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which is taken altaea and malvas, because by that the instrument of it is alleviated with few causes.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	If the instrument of it is excused near this cure, then you separate the disruption a little with an instrument in which they are inserted to make morrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better, when it is properly administered so that it does not become tedious, and there is no occupation to hinder its necessity and failure.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, thus you will see the shape of it:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the sharp-edged knife, and the other not-acute, and the subtle extremity, and it should not be in the subtlety of the spatula, unless it is obtained with a few.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And then when the plague is amplified and goes outside the intestine, then it is necessary that its reduction follows the form of its natural location, in its own proper place, if possible, because better is.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	However when the disruption is large, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then it is necessary that you make the patient lie on their back, and place their legs thus higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you place their head thus higher than their chest, and the parts below.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then you place your attention and consideration always on this, so that the part where the plague is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is necessary that you administer this in severe plagues and in mild plagues.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small plagues, place this that is prepared for you, and make it so that the minister is among your most skilled hands, which holds the disruption whole in its hand and adjusts the lips of it, and uncover from that to him who knows the suture of some other cause.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one that takes the needle, or count of needles according to the quantity of the amplitude of the plague; and then you release the extremity of the disruption of the ring finger, and stretch the needle once, without putting faith in the two extremities of the cord, as two extremities of the ciphac which is below the cord of the divided parts, until you make it penetrate that part; and you have already added the two extremities of the cord and the two extremities of the ciphac, and so you form four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then you stretch with double faith in the circuit of the needle, and some divisions of two parts together, and then add the two lips to the plague for decent addition; and then you release the thickness of the finger and fix another needle there, and then you tie it with double faith as if it were the primary needle; and do not cease doing this if it is necessary among the needles until you complete the entire contraction of the plague.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And thus the mild needles are between roughness and subtlety, because the subtle needles more lightly pierce the flesh; and the large ones are difficult to insert into the cord, and therefore it is necessary that they be mild in subtlety and roughness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be fixed in two extremities of the cord properly, so that the flesh is not lightly pierced and the plague is healed before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And there should not be prolonged sutures because the plague should not be prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then you insert the extremities of the needles so that they do not let the patient turn over to their own dormier; and you place above the suture puffs expanded from the entire part, which hold the extremities of the needles; and then you release them until you know that the plague is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these species of suture with needles are in this manner more convenient in small plagues, because they have need of a suture with one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	However the second suture is communal: and it is that you administer a suture with four extremities, of the cord and two extremities of the ciphac, in one way, with a needle in which faith is enveloped in subtlety and roughness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, you return the needle to that same part of the cord from which it began, so that the faith retracts from the most sublime part to the plague, so that the suture is according to the suture of a drawstring in which the strings are strengthened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And in such a suture I have seen the plague that was affecting a man in his belly which had been plagued by a contusion, and it was the disruption of the largest plague of one palm, and it was situated around two palms from the intestine of my middle place and it was the disruption in the middle of the limb; and then I have reduced that deposit which the intestine had been without the plague for 23 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plague was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around, and I cured it and it is healthy; and then I visited him for many years, and it is converted into its dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors have judged that it was not a curable illness; and by miraculous chance, because you did not cure that patient, because it was in a place where the patient was not touched by any medicine, but instead I put many doses of warm water on the affected area every day and diligently gave him honey mixed with melon water until he was cured.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	Perhaps you did not direct two special types of sutures properly, according to the narrative of Pareula.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with the suture of the groin, and you insert a needle from the front part to the back part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And then as the needle penetrates into the groin and in that same moment it goes straight according to rectitude and length of the whole body, and there is the extremity of the sciatic nerve where you inserted the needle; and make it penetrate from one extremity to the other, from the back part to the front part, in the other extremity of the thigh.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And then as you have made that penetrate, then make it penetrate another way in the same extremity of the thigh from the back part to the front part; and there is the extremity of the sciatic nerve which is in this region, and make the needle penetrate from one extremity to the other, from the back part to the front part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate also your penetration, which you make penetrate into the sciatic nerve in the extremity of the thigh, which is inside the patient's body until all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin from this same moment to extract that which is in the extremity of the sciatic nerve on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the groin which penetrated, and then return it to its place in the groin and body of the sciatic nerve which is on the other side of this extremity of the thigh; and withdraw that from the groin which belongs to the patient.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make it one way and another, and make it one way and then another way until you collect all that which is beforehand according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you collect a suture of pellicles in which you gather the skin, so that you collect the sciatic nerve one way from the part of the extremity of the groin, and then leave another way until it is completed.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	Perhaps the second special type of suture proper, which is said by Gualia, and this is from the serum of the patient and recommended for him, it is that you collect according to similarity in which you gather medicinal alchemy, so that they add all the part to its comparable part in the convenient nature; and apply the extremity of one to the extremity of the thigh and the other extremity, and this is done according to what you have recommended.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	That you fix the needle in the extremity of the thigh at your proper distance from the back part, and make it penetrate to the front part in that sole, and leave two extremities of the sciatic nerve; and then revolve the needle and make it penetrate from the back to the front in two extremities of the sciatic nerve.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then revolve those circles, and make them penetrate certain parts from the front to the back in two extremities of the thigh other than those which are on the contrary side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suturing is better than the common ligature, and it is a suture of which I previously mentioned in remembrance.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the serum of Gualia.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And perhaps the dissector says that a suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, so it is that you insert in these a few threads, and begin with an introduction of the needle from what belongs to you, and make it penetrate into the other side according to the suture of those who gather the hollowed-out bodies.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And you know that when disruption is in the middle location of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than in other locations of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	Perhaps the judgment of medicinal treatment of plague is a judgment of other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which cause is because when you consider the recent plague with the holy saint beforehand, that the air alters it, and reduces the intestine and gathers it and adapts it decently, then pause over that incarnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then pause over those gathered threads which are present in you, until they make hard skin and cut the fibers, and consolidate sciatic nerve and thigh; and then cure it thus as is the cure of other plagues, until it is healthy.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	Perhaps if you do not have the medicines, then pause over that much, because it begins to gather arm, warm water, and exchange those two doses a day, thus as you and teach, until it is healthy, because you do not need another medicine in many dispositional cases when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas. E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cover the small corrupted area little by little, because if it is in the cavity of the corrupted bone and does not appear in its appearance to the senses, and force the closure of the other side.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and does not emerge, although it is one continuous part with the other, and the corruption is in the middle or in a part of it, then you discover the entire flesh of all parts; and stop putting a table underneath, and stop covering that of the first part where the corruption enters until the closure of the other part is continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And make the closure according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, then dissect that corrupted joint, and stop the bone where it continues from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in its reason but rather in the ingenium (or perhaps "in the engine" or "in the mechanism", but it's likely that "ingen" is an old word for a body part or a system).
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest or foot, it is very difficult; however, cover so that you inquire about the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and that you grasp it, and remove it according to whatever disposition is possible for you, and also in case your ingenium (or engine/system) can be rectified by you, when it does not cause you contrariety or nervousness.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you know what instruments are suitable and the closures to cut these bones are very subtle according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and their rarity; so that you prepare all species of operation and convenient instrument for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you know that this operation depends on the species of instrument which you need; when you have great study and long experience and knowledge of the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of illnesses, because then you have them for yourself to measure what is convenient for the instruments in all illnesses.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you will find in the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will need, as I will simplify them as those that proceed to your prohibition which you will experience about the others.

E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not convenient unless you have that awl confricated with the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or it is a large wide mouth.
