E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly you know that all the causes that we have said about razors and incisors and closures.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	About the extremities of incision and the closure of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are weakened either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, or because you have medicated that corruption with the cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or sometimes the corruption worsens and goes to the member which is not perceived by any cause, then you know that you should incise that member until it reaches the place where the corruption is, so that the evil may evacuate through it, either by death or by major defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that one to whom it happens, is that the member becomes black until it is understood that fire has already consumed it, or it becomes blacker until the blackness reaches that member which is dead and takes all the body; and thus you know about the incision of that one.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	It seems that the cause of the corruption is a percussion of certain venomous causes, such as the sting of a scorpion or of a viper, or of rue.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you inject the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it does not enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it reaches the hand, then you inject at the root of the little finger, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes hold in the little finger of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you want to affect that, then inject into the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond and surrounds the elbow, then in that case it is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause for the cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly if corruption affects the foot when it reaches the toe of the foot, then you inject into that up to one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the sole of the foot, then you inject into the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	Maybe if it spreads to the knee, then you inject into the leg up to the joint of the knee.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the knee, then it is not possible to cure it except by dismissal, and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way to inject into the limb or to sew it up is that you stretch the ligament in the part below where you want to inject, and stretch another ligament over the area; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments until it is totally discovered; and then it is injected or sewn up.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And take care that it is placed far from the ligaments of all parts so that it does not touch the area, and that the patient's lesion is adjusted and an abscess is cautiously avoided.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	Maybe if there is a flow of blood when you operate, then you cauterize the area carefully, or stop it with some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with a ligament at a convenient place, and cure it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his sick foot, this same accident which you and I have recommended, which is to burn the blackness in the sick foot with adjustment that was assembled for combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption happens primarily in the sick toe until it reaches the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for the cure, since he wants to remove the annoyance from the limb with the vehemence of that which takes away pain and distress, and injects into that foot up to the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago, it happened to him that same corruption in the finger of the hand indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it came to me, and I have perfectly performed the percussion of that superfluity on the hand of the medicines, according to the mundification of the body; and it is not rebounded, the superfluity, until it begins to move into the other finger up to where it begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And they asked me to inject the hand of his, and I did not want to do anything that would rebound on the percussion of that superfluity, and maybe I was afraid of the injection of the hand of his death, because the virtue of the patient was in danger.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he separated from me, he returned to his land and it happened to me that the man prepared and injected his entire hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except to be a helper regarding what is said about this illness, and that it may be significant for which it is signified and according to which it is worked.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the care of joints and the quality of cleansing with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When abscesses occur in certain carnal members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of blood, and then it bursts and perforates, and the blood is drained from it, and remains in the place where it was as if it were a vessel, and the cord that is above it thus subsides, and it does not reach the last corruption, and it does not impress on the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Maybe if the space is prolonged until the corruption penetrates into a member, then it is called fistula and not sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that you inject the entire cord thus as it is revolved, and mainly when it is subsided and made thin like a thread, and you ensure that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Maybe if you think that the cord adheres and that corruption has not achieved its last consequence, and in the cord it has passed from one side to the other, then you cure that man by cleansing.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	It is necessary to consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the arm that you hold is of fetid odor, then cleanse with Egyptian medicine, which is made from oil and vinegar and zinc oxide, receiving divided parts equally, and adjust them in a small vessel, and apply them over the focus until the medicine is fully absorbed and pervades to a specific melancholy.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take of the water that is necessary and dissolve the medicine in water and honey; and cleanse with that in the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for a quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that precious medicine; and do it for so many days until the sinus is purified and the putridity is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Some burned ashes are cleansed with water of cinnamon, when it is not present to you at this medicine; and it is that you take the ash of vitriol, and mix it with the water; and then strain that and cleanse with it until you confirm that the sinus is fully opened.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not have tolerance to the Egyptian medicine or the water of cinnamon, then cleanse with the medicine in water and honey, which is mixed with zinc oxide, and cleanse with it in wine and honey, because the property of honey is that it purifies and cleanses, and it makes the sinus adhere, and it increases when there is an excess of moisture and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do some burned ashes and confirm that the sinus is already cleaned, then cleanse with the medicine in water that makes the flesh of the leg tender.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of the oily dyaphinicon and dissolve it in oil of rose and vinegar; or that you cleanse with those medicines and other oils that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on oils.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow where the cannula of the syringe is not received, then you amplify it by adding a little iron little by little, and pause in the warm water wrapped in Egyptian oil or in basilicon oil until it is amplified.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you join the lips of the medicine with a suture and leave it for a quantity in which the syringe is introduced.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of it from which the arm flows is elevated to the upper parts, then dry that in the pus below the place where it is in the body so that the arm may flow until below, because when the arm is constricted at the entrance of the sinus, the flesh will be engendered.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus until the environment of the pus below according to your will, then you should prepare the member with preparation for which the arm flows lightly according to what is apparent to you and that no cause of the arm is retained.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidative medicines that are placed over the sinus conveniently adapted to water that you want to extend those onto a cloth of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth is of such great quantity as it makes communication with all the sinus; and then insert the forked instruments into the right orifice of the sinus, making a wide passage for a little while; and then extend onto another cloth of linen with the oils of leons according to the quantity of the passage, and place it over that for a long position near the orifice of the sinus so that the evacuation of the arm is alleviated and no great cloth is needed except for some days a burned ash.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	That which is over the orifice of the sinus, which you clean in an entire hour so that you extract what is adjusted in the body of the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if what flows from the arm is much or little, whether it is digested, or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And also you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is in an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medication is prolonged in such a manner, and you see the material that is placed over the orifice of the sinus already adheres, or it takes proper adhesion, then you may remove it on the third or tenth day, and when you remove the plague, then change the cloth for another and renew the oil.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if the sinus is properly spaced, then no virus can subtly enter, then do not despair of the adhesion of it, because the healing of it is proper, because some homes are in those which delay the generation of flesh in the aforementioned plagues, and of those which make the contrary of it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinus for many days is an undigested arm, then you know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and it is a prolonged cause, then you adjust in the desiccation of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried thus like Egyptian oil, when there is an adjusted excess of addition of zeigy.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last medicine which is curative, it is that you take of Egyptian oil and dissolve it in rose oil, and it is over the vial into which the anticyptic substance is added, and then confirm that with the body, and use that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems to be doing an action, when there is no arm, in a confined space, as much as it is possible to be gross, and use of it; or that you take mirra and aloen and enses, and trissa all and pulverize over the honey that is on the focus, and then draw lines over the drap and strengthen it over the sinus; and draw lines over the honey which has been confined so that it is gross, and pulverize over the drap and strengthen it over the sinus.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some vegetables should be administered in the long aristology and roots of celestial lilies (and they are celestial lilies) and flour of errors and centauria, and use of those simples or adjust them, trissa those and crumble and pulverize over the honey that has been recommended; and remove from it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged, and it is not healed by this cure, then you know that the corruption is in the pruning of it, and make an inquiry into the bones or other hard members or ligaments; then you heal with a fistular cure, thus as it is said below.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the cure of painful and worn-out nails and toenail incisions added to the division.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Painful nails are an abscess which grows beneath the nail of the finger or toe, and they grow in other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less expected, or it is abscessed by a cautious abscess, or it is corrupted, and you should cut into it so that it corrodes the root of the nail, and it corrupts all, and it perverts its corruption to the bone within, so that it becomes fetid odor, and it makes the extremity of the finger lame, and the color of it becomes darkish.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And then when you have that which we have said in the division and it does not conform to your cure, then you should burn all the superfluous flesh that has grown from the nail and then cauterize the wound with fire, because cauterizing is not helpful in this way.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail have already comprehended the flesh at the divided parts, and they begin to putrefy and rot, then you should pause with subtle rays beneath the angle of the nail that touches the flesh, and impel it under and incise that flesh to facilitate, and pause over what remains of the flesh from the corrosive medicines that burn within so that it is totally removed; and then cure that which has been grossly affected until it is healthy.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already taken hold in the bone, then you should incise the bone itself and extract it, because no time is lost when the corrupted bone is in the body.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption go into the finger, then you should incise it in one of the nodes according to its remembrance, and then cure it until it is healthy.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail receives percussion or attrition, and receives in that violent pain, then you should begin to fleubotomize the patient, and then cut off the nail with a spatula-like instrument transversely from below upwards, and be careful that the cutting does not penetrate into the flesh beneath the nail, lest you cause more violent pain, and it will be the cause of the superfluous growth of the flesh in that place; and then cure that place where it ceases to hurt.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But this is adjusted, which is born in the hands of some men, because it is entirely flesh, and it is entirely in the bones, or it is entirely in the nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or it is the birthplace of them in some nodes of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in some nodes of the finger does not get worse, and that which is born in the joints is entirely bad.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are fleshy growths, the cutting is easier, and it is that you should incise them from their root with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of its abscess.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in that which is born on the fingers from the nodes, you should incise at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then saw with one of those convenient saws according to what, and then cure it until it is healthy.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation which accelerates the fingers among the worn-out joints or by birth of the man who is thus, or for consolidation of the wound or for combustion of fire, or for similarity, therefore you should cut off that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.

And similarly if consolidation accelerates in some fingers on the palm, then you should cut off that consolidation according to how it is prepared and conforms to the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	From the examination of ulcers, they are various.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Ulcers are various, and they are enveloped by thick, full superfluous melancholic humors which come from the members of the body, and their greatest influence is in the legs, and they are greatly influenced in the legs of travelers and workers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer purification of the body from black bile by evacuating strongly, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	There are two ways to cure them of iron ferrous: one is that the black blood is evacuated and its bad properties are removed, and the other way is that the vein is elevated and all the blood is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning of it is done in this way: at the beginning, apply a warm compress to the leg until the thick blood is resolved, which is purulent in the leg, and then stretch the patient's leg to the partition above the thigh, into the hollow of the knee, with one bandage, and then section the vein in one place, or two, or three, with ample sectioning, and then elevate the black blood from the bottom of the partition below the leg, upwards, until the quantity that you want is eliminated and which time you will have mastered, and which will tolerate the virtue of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then leave it, and command him to abstain from black bile-inducing foods.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full and that does not harm the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of them is done in this way: you who raise the patient's leg, if there are many pelles, and then place it on a bench and apply a warm compress to the leg until it becomes red and the veins are exuberant; or it should be exercised with strong exercise, if the bench is not at your present, until the member is scalified.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo. E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then as you evacuate and remove the codeina, you see that white humour which was formerly cordial.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place it below the radius until it is elevated and freed from the codeina, and suspend it with an unguent or ointment of lion's blood.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then section another section, and section that section for three days, and then excoriate the codeina from the partition below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate it and insert it into the back section of the ankle, and then extract it and elevate it until it is eliminated through the second section, and then extract it from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela. E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada. And if life is constricted having twisted to the one that is enveloped in the parts, and it is not according to rectitude according to what we have said, then you should confine yourself above all the twisting of it and the places of its enveloping, and then suspend it with an unguent until it elevates all.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And beware of your section that you do not insert the vein and that you do not plague it, because it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and preserve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Method of inserting into the one whose life is sectioned:
Forma de unci orp:	Method of anointing with ointment:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to be applied excessively, thus with the ointments neither of acute extremity so that it does not plague the vein; and it is of great flexibility, because if it were subtle, it would insert the vein by its subtlety; having been in excessive grossness thus as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of veins of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs on cold and dry lands, thus like the Athenians in Arabic lands and in Indian lands, which are dry and arid with little tenderness, and in which there are no herbs or breezes.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And strongly rooted in other places of the body are the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is by putrefaction that you see in the channel, thus venomous darts pierce the body, and generate serpents and worms and snakes born between the intestine and the flesh.

And the sign of the suspicion of its advent is from this vein that causes inflammation in the leg with vehement swelling; and then the place is evacuated; and then the vein is cleared of the humor from the place of that evacuation, which seems to reject a plant-like residue.

And then it appears from there the extremity, then you will find that you are wrapped around a piece of lead weighing one drachm, up to two drachms, and not exceeding that, and let the lead be suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as the eyes of the afflicted area are affected by some cause beforehand, wrap it in lead and apply that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the motion is prolonged, then you inject a portion of it and wrap the remainder; and do not inject that which seems to be contrary until it is fully evacuated, because if you inject that, it contradicts and enters into the flesh, causing aposteme and putridity in the place and bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because it is necessary that it be treated gently and extracted little by little, until it is fully expelled from the back of it and nothing remains of it in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein it is extracted in some men who are in their longevity of 5 palms and of toes, and already I have arrived at a point where I extract one of 20 palms.

And if it is injected at the time of its medication, then introduce the radium into the tract of it and perforate that long tract in the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the place for several days with medicines; and then cure it by curing apostemes.

De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	About the generation of worms under the skin, and it is called cattle disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some land as our cattle disease because it often occurs in the thighs and is a worm that is born between the intestine and the flesh, and goes throughout the entire body, weakening and debilitating, and shows itself by the sentiment of each member, from member to member, until it disrupts the intestine and exits.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is by putrefaction of certain humors, thus causing worms and serpents and roundworms and ascarids to grow in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its malice, because when it goes into the body and reaches the head, and arrives at the whiteness, then strongly roots are born in it and enter and destroy the whiteness, and often occur many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure it and extract it, then do not fail to use the ambulation and apparition of it according to the sentiment, and consequently it is necessary that you strengthen what is above it and what is below it with ligament and constriction, and then dry above it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit. De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	About the section on nafer's disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is named in our land nafer, and it is pain that occurs in some members, and then it is spread from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And already I have seen that according to what I recommend to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You were called to a sick woman in a village, and you discovered her swollen arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and since you stayed for an hour, you saw that inflammation go away thus as it was going down from there, but more lightly than it should be, thus if it were silver you would see it corroding from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then I put myself in the pain of that place and fixed myself in the muscle, and then I stayed there for an hour.

Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	Perhaps it is not visible in the eyes, just as it is in women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada. E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this backward curvature in those who are delicate and have a humid body with weakened veins.

Perhaps you have not seen those evil eyes, then you cure him by exciting the body and that which expels bad temperaments, and cleanse those foul pills of serpent-like and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to species, and according to the places of the body in which they fall, because their diversity is that some have large points, and small ones, and concave, and rough, so they are solid; and of those that have three angles, and of those that have tongues; and of those that have astellas (possibly "wings" or "tips").
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the wounds in which they fall is according to two manners: because the principal members are concave, such as the brain, heart, liver, lung, kidneys, intestines, and veins, and their similars; and therefore when you cut into one of these members and appear to sense death, which causes you to recoil, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that arrow from those in which death sits in the major dispositions, and when you do not appear so bad, and the arrow is not embedded in the depth of the member, then you extract it and cure the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the symptoms of the wound is when you cut into the arrow, and it pierces the bone, and it sits on the siphac which is above the brain, because it causes vehement pain, and scotomia, and vertigo, and rigor in the eyes, and inflammation and rigor of the tongue, and spasm and permutation of understanding and vomiting of cholera, and the strength is absent and the voice is destroyed, and it sits on the place of the wound with humid white pus-like matter, and you see something similar to abscesses of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if you appear to have these symptoms, then you abstain from the cure and extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	Perhaps the symptoms of the arrow when it pierces the heart are so near to the left breast, and you feel as if something is fixed in a hard cause, and not a fleeting cause; and therefore the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the pulse, and the color of the wound is black, and there is a coldness of the extremities, and numbness, and syncopes; and therefore you know that death descends from all sides.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the symptoms when the arrow has wounded the lung are expectation of bloody spittle from the wound, and the veins that are near the neck are apostematized, and the color of the patient's complexion is changed, and he exhales a great deal of spirit, and demands attraction of fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow is stuck in the peritoneum which is in the foot, and the pain then is near the small ribs, and it makes a great cry with vehement pain and suspense, and does not move all the members of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow is stuck in the stomach, then therefore you see signs of the wound being accompanied by some indigestion.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow is stuck in the abdomen, and it is fixed in it, you see some fissure of the wound, or the web, or intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope in the cure by extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bladder, and it is obstructing the urine, and it causes some cause to the partitions beforehand, and therefore there is pain over the patient's body, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Perhaps the other members are like the face, neck, and gullet, and the shoulders and the adjacent ones, and the vertebrae of the back, and the fork, and the hip, and the leg, and their similars among the members, are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not touch a vein or artery and is not a poisonous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And you recommend that to you who have seen the essence of these arrows, because they signify for that above the true cure.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which cause is, because in one house an arrow falls into the lacrimal duct of his eye in the radix of the nose, and you extract it from him to another part, leaving the gray humor of his eye, and he is healed, and does not affect the eye of the document.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And if you extract another arrow from a Jew's quiver, which was hidden in the gray area of the shoulder, then the eyelid would be swollen and then the arrow would have been completely concealed and not found until a small extremity stuck to the shoulder flesh, and it was a great arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, at Ferrileon where there were no golden ornaments.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	It is the fault of the Jew, and he did not have a bad accident on his shoulder.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And you extracted another arrow from a Christian man whose arm was pierced by an Arabic arrow, and it was the one with golden ornaments; and then you had inserted something between two guides over that, and it was submerged in his arm; and then you were subtle about that, and you carefully extracted it, and it healed the Christian.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And you extracted another arrow from a man whose stomach was pierced by it, and you thought he would die from that; and then, since he passed thirty days without any change in his condition, you inserted something over the arrow and engaged with it, and it healed, and it was not a bad accident for him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	I saw a man in whom an arrow was stuck in his back, and the wound had consolidated over him, and since he received proper care for seven years, you removed the arrow from the root of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I saw a woman in whom an arrow was stuck in her stomach, and the wound had consolidated inside her, and it did not change in her condition in reality, and the woman did not have any harm in some of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	I saw another man in whom an arrow was stuck in his face and the wound had consolidated, and you removed the arrow, not causing much pain, and many signs seemed to indicate that.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And you extracted the arrow from the man of the king's princes which was stuck in a hidden place near his nose and had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was completely concealed.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And you were called for the cure of him due to the removal of the arrow within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then you touched the wound of the arrow very gently; and then you inquired about that with a subtle touch, and did not feel it; but I felt it a little below the right aurelia, and then I suspected that this puncture was due to the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I plastered the place where I had applied attractive and digestive remedies, convincing myself that the place would be purified for it to appear to me as the place of the arrow, so that it would succeed over that.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And it did not happen at the significant accident place that the arrow had reached that place; and you continued with the plaster over it for many days and no accident happened; and the wound consolidated meanwhile, and the badness of the excess of it was removed in many days until one day I felt the arrow inside my nose and recognized it to myself.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then you applied acute corrosive medicine to the wound for many days until it was opened, and with a tender touch I felt that, and touched the extremity of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the flesh.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then you adjusted in the opening of the wound for that acute medicine until it appeared visibly to me the extremity of the arrow, and I spent my time on that for a period of four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then because the wound was amplified, and it was possible for me to insert the forceps into it, and I remained there, and did not obey the judgment, then you did not cease to subtly engineer and contrive about that in many ways of ingenuity, until one day you began to descend with forceps fashioned like teeth, according to what will be seen at the end of the chapter, until you extracted it; and then you restored the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and you restored it and the wound consolidated, and it healed entirely, and it did not remain in any condition.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And you recommended to yourself the quality of extracting certain arrows because it pauses the rule and significance over that which I have not said, since the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not understood in narration nor do they comprehend it freely.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the craftsmen know how to compare little about much; and it is present about what is absent; and they introduce a new operation and novel instrument, which descends from the external causes of the art when they are accidental.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore you say that arrows are not forgotten in the members where they are fixed, but rather in two ways: either by attraction to the place where they entered; or by contrast with the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is gone through the place where it entered, or is an arrow proceeding from a fleshy location, and it is attracted and forgotten.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the judgment of the hour in which it happens, then it is necessary that you leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it becomes purulent, and its attraction and exit are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	It seems that the patient is stuck in you and does not obey your will, then leave that for some days and afterwards take it to a doctor's attention and move it on any day, and already it has been forgotten.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your will, then wait for some days, afterwards you should perforate in the circuit of the arrow in that entire affected part with subtle travel within so that the place is amplified by the arrow, and then extract that.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the head's bone and has proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and it appears in the patient with those accidentz which you have said and told, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it there until the sick person can be equalized for some days; because if the arrow reaches the ciphac, then death is not prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not stuck but only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the ciphac, and the patient remains for some days, and no accidentz happen to him from those causes, then you will engage in the attraction of the arrow and in the attraction of it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Perhaps if it is not stuck and does not obey your extraction, then you administer travels in the circuit of the arrow thus as we have recommended, and then take care to heal the place until it is healthy.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	Perhaps if the arrow is already embedded in the body's location, and it is embedded with sentiment, then you inquire about that in tenta, and if you feel that, then aim at that with some instruments which are convenient for its attraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot operate on it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the instrument, and here there is no bone nor nerve nor vein, then you feel upon the wound until it is enlarged and it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if you have the aurelhas which are held, then you deliver the flesh in which it is stuck from entire affected part to the very end that you may do; and ingeniate upon that, if you cannot operate on the evasion of the flesh in the fracture of the aurelhas and in twisting of those until it obeys.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any location where it is, then you use your hand with forceps on all affected parts until it makes that obey; and subtly use a subtle delicacy so that the arrow is not broken and it is made difficult for you to attract it and its extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot operate on that at your time, then leave it for some days until the parts that are in its circuit can be restored, and afterwards take it out because then it is alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	Perhaps if you have made a contrary flow of blood, then you administer that which we have said about the cure in the sick head chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And beware of your vertebrae of inscizio of vein or of nerve, or of cord, and administer ingeniously in all manner possible for the evasion of the arrow; and make that facilitated and tranquil and tardy and firm thus as you have and I recommend.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And thus you make counter-pressure on the arrow so that the patient is according to the figure according to which you find the case of the arrow in him, because it may be more juvenile.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	Perhaps if that is not possible for you, then you administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	Perhaps the arrows that are forgotten by the counter of the other part, or that already proceed to some part from outside, or have made the extrication of the arrow by sentiment of the part above the codena propdana and times that eminent; then you see about that; and it is the section according to the quantity in which they take the forceps; and then aim at that, because it is made lighter for the will.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	Perhaps if it is retained in the bone, then you twist the lame according to counter-pressure until the arrow emerges from the bone, and amplify so that it meets, and then extract that.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave that for some days, and then try again until you succeed.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then you impel it with him.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	Perhaps if the shaft is fallen and you want to administer impulse, then you introduce and that, if it is blunt, instrument concavely so that it enters the concavity of him in the hollow of the arrow and then impel it with him.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	Perhaps if the arrow is concave, then you impel it with a strong instrument entering into that, because the arrow is alleviated by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is intoxicated, then wait for you to concave all the flesh in which it is, if that is possible for you, and then take care of that with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow is caught in the foot, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the rib, and it is close to you touching that with the tent, and it is possible for you to see about that, then see about that and beware of inscizio of vein or of nerve, and extract that, and afterwards close the wound if it indiges, and take care of that until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The form of forceps that are customarily used to remove arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	They are like the extremities of birds with a beak-like shape that are made sharp when they take hold of the arrow so that it does not slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of those are made special motifs, large, few and moderate, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and of its slight weakness, and of the amplitude of the wound, and of its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of an instrument concave to this extremity that is adapted with a bird's beak shape in order to alleviate the instrument of the arrow from it, and impulse of that sordid.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of an instrument of sordid extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	thus with a radius in order to alleviate the instrument from it into the concave arrow and it is propelled with that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of the bloodletting of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua. Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.
