E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of theirs when the middle of theirs is broken, it is that which declines to the internal parts and adheres to the great pain, and difficulty in the hale, and toes, and strengthens and vomits blood; and it is declared in the cavity of the broken bone and does not hide from the sentiment.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of theirs is that the patient be resupinated on their own back, and placed between the shoulders of theirs with one cushion; and then press on their muscles, and adjust their ribs to the more than two rib-stops, and subtily proceed in the operation of theirs and in the equalization according to every manner that is possible and convenient, until the figure of the bone returns as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then place on their dressing and stop and place above the starry board of subtle table of sawdust or of chalk and of its similar levitation, since you envelop that in drap; and then subtily proceed to bind that above the broken bone so it is not moved; and go with the binding according to retonditat on the back some vegetables, and strengthen that with decent structure; and then consider the binding at every hour, and when it is softened, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to provoke the dislocation of that from corrosion or bruising, or pain, or abscess that adheres in the place, then you will cut and dissect that and eradicate the dressing and rectify what adheres for that manner of cure; and then reduce the dressing, if times return to that face; and adjust their structure until it is healthy.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are fractured.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur except in gross places that follow the back; and of the extremities of theirs from the front part do not adhere to those contradictions unless for what is cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And knowledge of theirs is not hidden from the sentiment because of the inquiry into theirs with the fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that it envelops the fracture in the fingers according to the possible method, so that it is enveloped according to what is convenient, and then apply a plaster and strengthen the broken bone in its place, if needed.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the fracture of the ribs is declining into the divided parts, then it causes the patient vehement pain and puncture, just as puncture that causes pain to one who has suffered a fall, and because of this, the bone sets in its covering; and it causes difficulty in breathing, and coughing, and vomiting of much blood; and this is a difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Anticodes have been prepared in that matter with many ingenious remedies.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And of them it is said: they cause the patient to take windy remedies that generate inflammation and flatulence, so that the belly becomes inflated and extended, and the fracture is driven out to the divided parts beforehand.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We must avoid giving him that remedy so that it does not cause the gathering of evil humors, if it does not help; and if it does help, then it will assist in that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they discovered some of them that were stopped under the windings and then sucked with a strong fortitude; and it is similar to reasoning, but most of the time it is feared that the windings attract the superfluities to the place of debilitation.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they discovered some of them: it is said that the place should be covered with wool that has been submerged in hot oil, and powders are placed between the ribs until it is full, so that it is the binding that envelops according to retention; and then the patient is treated with a cure of poultices and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes vehement constriction to the patient who does not suffer, and the bone puts its covering in punctured pain, they think about the patient, then it is said that they should put a bandage on the place, discover the broken rib, and then stop using that instrument which preserves the phlegm, the remembrance of which precedes, and which facilitates the bone, and extracts it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with a closure, and heal it with plasters until it is sound.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it causes divided aposteme, then you should apply a cushion and pour powders in rose oil and place them on the area, and the patient is treated with what is suitable for the divided aposteme.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And it should be raised above the bed where he sleeps, until it is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine, back, and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some veiled injuries involve fracture of the neck bones, and similarly they have an atrition, and it is similar to the vertebrae of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And with that, it causes harm to some and wants to know if it will be healed or not, then consider, because many times the veins are more mollified and stupified and deadened and cannot move them nor extend nor strengthen them, and when they constrict them in the tender fingers or prick them with a needle and do not feel pain, then you know that it is not healed, and in the midst of these dispositions it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if it moves them and feels in them a constriction in the fingers and puncture, then you know that the nut of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the vertebrae of the neck similar to that and want to know if it will be healed or not, then consider its weight.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you see that it is mollified, it causes harm to those who have been affected in the same way, and then when they sit on their back, they experience windiness and lack of appetite according to their will, and some veiled injuries are raised above their back and want to urinate but cannot, then you know that it is mortal, and therefore do not struggle with its treatment.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	We must not attribute some cause to those, the cause is worse and more evil.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment of it is that you perform a sedation of the evil humors that gather above the atrited spine with rose oil sol, or with mugwort of hue and sat; place it on those veiled injuries every day until the evil humors are sedated.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then place one of the comforting and soothing plasters, and strengthen it above that wound; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the side where he feels pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it causes the atrition of the satiated bones or some cause that has already been separated from it, then it is said to secede above the codena and to remove that bone; and then adjust the two lips of the wound, with a suture if it is large; and then heal it with an encarnated remedy for the enguements, until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	We must if the bone is broken in the last vertebrae, and it is the end of the coccyx, then it is said that you should enter the finger of your left hand into the anus, and envelop the broken bone with the other hand according to what is possible for secondary equilibrium; and then place a plaster on it and bind it, if needed, and strengthen it.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	If you feel stagnant humors settled in the patient, then put a warm compress on them, and remove that, and take care to cure the plague as it is preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the narrow (passage).
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the narrow passages are so broken, and if they break, then the fracture is only communicated to the extremities of those and are inserted in the length and decline to the divided parts; and it causes great pain in the place and puncture, and the leg is stupefied when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over it until it is above the fracture which is the shape of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is in the extremity of it alone, then you bind it according to what appears to you by equalizing the binding until it is assembled to its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the loin or has already declined to the lower parts, then you make a plaster over the sick belly until it is prepared for you to restore that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And then when you have bound it, pause on the plaster, and place a pause on that wooden or cotton splint, and strengthen by stricture over which there is no fear of puncture of fracture nor movement of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And bind the concavity with water that fills it until it takes the stricture according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on their back or on their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if it causes a hot abscess, then you cease the extension of it and its restoration until the hot abscess is sedated, and pause on the water that sits over it according to what is preceded; and then return to the restoration of it, and strengthen it thus in a convex shape.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if they are stagnant humors or are communicated, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the adjutator (helper).
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjutator is that which is between the elbow and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is broken, then the restoration of it is in one of two manners, one of which is that you take a wooden plate of moderate thickness according to this form:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And there are two extremities of two ligaments, and then it is suspended from the elevated place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient on a chair; and then he puts his broken arm on the wood until it reaches the tiny end of it in the middle place where the curvature of the wood is annexed.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then it is suspended above some heavy cause, or the minister extends that to the lower parts; and then the doctor says that the fracture is in its places most often, until the fracture returns according to its convex shape.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other manner is that the patient is resupinated on their cervical spine and suspends the hand of the neck with ligament; and then he commands two ministers that one of them holds water above the fracture in its places most often; and the other holds the pus below it; and almost all of them extend to their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then you strengthen over the fracture with ligament and over that with another ligament, and almost all of the two ministers extend to their two parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And so if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, then it is fitting that half of the ligament be placed over the cilium and the other below the fracture towards the elbow.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is close to the elbow, then it is fitting that the ligament be placed over that place and over that elbow.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Bind it with facilitated and easy handling, and then when it is bound according to its convex shape and is applied for good application, then strengthen it if it does not cause hot abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if it causes hot abscess, then loosen the stricture until the seventh day, and pause on the woolen cloth wrapped in seven layers and oiled roses until the abscess rests, and then you strengthen it.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the manner of strengthening it is that you put a plaster on the fracture, and then you put a wrapping of new cloth over the plaster; and then you adjust the arm on that adjutator, and put your hand open over the shoulder muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And put the cloth and strengthen on the adjutator the arm so that the arm is in its place of stability, if it does not prohibit any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then it uses stability.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that which puts on the fracture that stability which is more firm and stronger than the other stabilities; and put between each stability the latitude of the digit, and let the length of the stabilities be according to the breaking with an addition of three digits from all parts.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then strengthen on the stabilities with the stricture which I said at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your stricture on the place of the fracture be more straight.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture has been lengthened according to the minor structure.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And so if you observe the positioning of the stars and the structure likewise as we have said at the hour in which you restore the member to its usual situation, then do it.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear an abscess, then place the structure and the stars within the seventh day likewise as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that it does not become inflamed or swollen at the site of the injury; or it is prohibited to bring food to the member by disposition of superfluous structure; and thus rectify all as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	Moreover, if you are confident that no cause of this will occur, then do not loosen the ligature until three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient's sleep be on their back, and their hands should be over the stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And apply the warm woolen dressing to the affected area, and consider at all hours of the night or day that the figure of the injured member is not distorted or dissolved, or that the ligament is softened, thus rectify all in accordance with your virtue.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And administer the food to the patient according to the order which we have previously mentioned, so that the food is subtle at the beginning until it begins to strengthen; and then cover the food of his.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	It is customary for the warm application and his leg to be strengthened in 40 days; and then it is necessary that they be loosened and bathed and medicated with ointments which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is badly broken, then you do not loosen the ligament and the stars within a day or within two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of fractures of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones which are called two forearm bones; one of them is small and it is the one that supports the hand, and the other is large and it is the one that is placed below the small bone, from the part above.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And sometimes the larger forearm bone is broken alone, or the smaller one, and sometimes they are both broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller forearm bone is broken below, then its restoration is easier, and its healing is even easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the bone of it is broken below the fracture, the breakage of it is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse than that is when both bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the smaller forearm bone below, then it is convenient for the doctor to make a small extension to facilitate its healing.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	Moreover, if the larger forearm bone is the one that is broken, then it is necessary to make a more vigorous extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both forearm bones are broken together, then it is necessary that you make the external treatment even stronger.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And it is necessary that you make the figure of the hand in such a way that its restoration and extended extension are supported on a cushion, and the pulse of the hand is at the parts below, more than all the other fingers, and the auricular finger is lower than the other fingers, and the patient should be seated on a wooden chair.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let there be a cushion placed underneath it in its elevation or inclination, so that the patient does not suffer trouble.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then the minister extends the arm from the part below to the hand or ligament, and another minister extends similarly from above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the doctor sets the bone in place so that it is reduced to its best figure as much as possible.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if the breakage of the bone is such that it is dislocated, then you must forcibly reduce all the mass to its place with your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if it appears that the dislocated bone is separated and cannot be reduced by your skill, then you should fix it in place and leave it according to the manner which we have mentioned above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	Moreover, if the fracture is a wound, I have already made a special chapter about it, and thus take its treatment.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort. And you will know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or in 32 days, or at least it is restored in 28 days, and all that is according to the disposition of the complexities and the dispositions of the virtue.

Capitol .xiv.	Chapter 14.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the restoration of fractures of the bone of the hip.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the hip is broken and declared to the sentiment according to what is converted to the part above and to the underlying pus.

And then leave the structure on that, so that it does not cause corrosion to the affected limb nor apostema nor inflammation and appears similar to those; and if any of these causes occur, then cut away the damaged part, and correct what is wrong, according to what we have said many times.

Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	About the fracture of the ankle and the bones of the foot and the toes.

Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	About the fracture of the hip joint of the woman and of the bone of the perineum and of the vertebrae of the spine.

E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do thus for seven days or around those, because that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take an ovation of egg and strengthen on the trajectory of hers a tube of cane; and insert all the vesicle into her hip joint, and then sufflate in the tube with vertu until the vesicle is inflated within the hip joint, because the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be filled with cotton and stood for several days according to what has been recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	When the bone of the penis in men or women is bruised, then administer restoration and agility to the water that has been recommended for the bone of the ankle.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And the water that is not hidden in these close fractures and that few encounter, mostly adds to that which is some study and use and intent of my free motion; because that fracture means you are in major dispositions via direct restoration and in the structure of it, and therefore intent being.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	Moreover, in the wound of the man when it is bruised, take a poultice of water, and put the wound in it; and then pause over the wrapping of cloth, and let it be wrapped, and then let it be left for three days or around that, and it will be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of fractures of bones when they are badly wounded.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for that which suffers a bad fracture, and mostly if the bone is large as well as the bone of the hip or of the joint, or similar to that, so that you take care and remove the fragments as soon as possible if the conditions of removal are favorable to you or testify as we have said before.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the wound flows blood, then it is necessary that you take care to retain it in this way, so that you powder over the wounded place, if no other cause is present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not prolong it, if you do not suffer from abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	Moreover, if you suffer from a hot abscess, then you delay the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess is calmed down, and do not approach it on the third day or the fourth of all, because you will cause bad accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	Moreover, if the broken bone is prominent above the uncovered elbow, then it is necessary that you perform to reduce it and bend it among your hands as much as facilitated and with little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	Moreover, if the extension is not prepared for your hands, then you reduce it among your hands as much as possible in this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight inches and the width of which is according to the quantity of the wound; and therefore it is necessary for the doctor to take hold of these three or four according to the quantity that indicates for it in the cure of all kinds of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And let it be rounded, and let it be in a small groove so that it is not doubled over itself during the operation hour.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And let it be of sharp extremity to which the margin is in the six extremities; and let the underside of it be thick and tending towards the middle, and of its greatness within the partitions.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is its shape:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek "labre volentz atelarem", which means a small spatula.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that it is necessary to pause the extremity of the sharp elevated above the extremity of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it in a gentle way until the bone returns, and let it be bent into some equilibrium.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And then it is necessary to bend the extremities of the fracture among them, and if the broken extremity is subtle, and you do not take that instrument for good acceptance, then it is necessary that you insert the extremity of that bone until the instrument has power over it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	Moreover, if you cannot reduce the bone in all that we have recommended, then insert it in all that is convenient for the bones of the incisors which we have said; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner it is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then scrape that which remains on the bone of roughness and of small scratches.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and then reduce the reduction to the patient with vehement pain ledent, then you will know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do that because you confer great judgment to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration is completed, which you do to the bone, and then submerge in a vi stooping black cloth, and properly if it is in summer, and do not pause over the soft wound or any other cause in which there is oil, so that it does not make the bone fragile and corrupt.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stitches in the hour of the completion of the bone restoration, and leave the uncovered wound in such a way that you insert the thread among forks and uses of wrappings according to the quantity of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And beware that you do not strengthen the wound on the fracture, because many vain efforts are made by foolish doctors, and they cause death or corrupting mortification or rottenness, so it is sanity.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the structure of the tieu is loose, soft, different from the structure of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	If the plague is great or bad, and you fear about that evil accident which has been recounted, and there is pain in the area, then do not cover it with those astellas, but rather make an envelope of thick, rough bandages around the area and strengthen it.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	When you have already begun to treat the plague once or twice a day, which has engendered heat, then remove the bandage that you had placed over the affected area in the morning, and administer cooling remedies, following our customary practice of treating plagues, just as we do with tetrafarmacon and similar remedies.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	It is convenient for you to dissolve the liament and consider the plague in any morning and evening until it is consolidated and fixed, and cover the member so that it is prepared in such a way that the pus can flow out of it easily.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague has passed many days, and it is not consolidated nor has it abscessed from the arm, then you know that here are signs of small ulcers because they cover the plague in tents.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those ulcers, those that are separated remain and extract, those that are not separated and touch the member and cause pain, therefore try to incise them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if you find that the plague is stagnant or ulcerous, it is symptoms of corruption and putrefaction, then cover one of those which is convenient for the cure of which the preceding narration was made in the seventh chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of that which covers the worst sermon and you make present your patience: when the gross is truncated, emollients are placed over the member just like the bones of the thigh and of the hip and similar to those of the large members, and do not presume attraction from it, nor the extraction of it four times a day, lest it kills; having laid aside that which prevents, because strong fire perishes if it is treated for 20 days or 30. And then you will cure the plague if you have seen it, and if not, lay aside that one.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the cure of numbness that occurs in the vicinity of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this numbness occurs in the vicinity of a healthy fracture, and it increases because it is close to the joints, and it is hindered by the figure of the member; and strongly prohibits the member from its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the numbness is recent and administer in those medicines that have been stipulated, such as aloen, enses, mira, sercacollo, acrassia, and similar to those; in order that you take some of those or all, and mix them so they are stipated with wine, or album of water, or with good agreement, and place it over the numbness in a stop, and constrict them over it for good constriction.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And leave the extrication that does not dissolve it for many days; and then dissolve it and iterate another, until the numbness is removed; or strengthen over that lamina of lead decentment, because lead has the property of removing all that which is inflated in the members.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Moreover, if the numbness has already been converted into stone and is strengthened and necessitates provoking ostensible contradiction, and then you should divide it by the superior part of the limb, and incise the superfluous and eminent, or cut away that which is in the way until it is removed; and cure it until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of a fracture when it is restored and then Roman law governs the subtle member and frees it according to its own natural nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of bone is restored, and then Roman law governs the subtle member and frees it, then that is not done except for many causes: one of which is the multitude of solution of the liament and of the ligature of the faulty joint according to what is convenient; or for superfluity of structure of the liaments until the nourishment is prohibited from reaching the member; or for multitude of superfluous embrocation; or for superfluous movement not in its hour; or for paucity of health in the body of the patient and for debility of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the cure of that is to give food to the patient and make their heart tender until the health is multiplied in them; and administer bath; and put gauze and lettuce over it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then place a poultice over the member, so that the poultice attracts to it much nourishment, or continues embrocation with water and tepid, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the cure of truncated bones when they are restored tortuously and prohibit the operation of their own which is convenient.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When you find the member already restored to health from tortuousness and eminence to the truncated bone and numbness, and it is for that fededa in the form of the member, but meanwhile the member is not prohibited from its own natural operation, then it does not cover that you receive the speech of one who existed before that member was newly truncated.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	More skilled doctors have set forth remedies and restorers which they have made available in our land; and this operation is most detestable, producing great fear of the sign of which is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If stiffness and numbness are recent, then it is believed that they are imbued with watery humor in which they are softened by mollifying herbs, and thus they are like fuels of high altitude and roots of the same, and milky, and similar to those; and it should be made into an emplaster of mollifying emplaster, thus making a good dissolution; or that it is taken from the mucilage of the root of the high altitude and is mixed with grey clay of gaulin or oil of cirami, and is emplastered there; or that they take fat figs and are trussed in the wombs of columns, and similar to those of the medicines which are named as consolidating remedies.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some wounds are dissolved by continuous friction of the ligature which is in the most humid places, and administration of movement to the entire limb should be done at all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If twisting has gone downwards and is made strong and converted into stone and provoked the need for cure with iron, then it is believed that the pus above has ceased and the continuity of the bone is dissolved, and something is inserted that suppresses the nodosity of those metacarpals in the bone in subtle incisions, and administration of facilitation is done in that which is solicited and studied.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On ulcers in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is a slipping out of some of the joints in their proper place, so that it is prohibited from movement, and the shape of the limb is distorted, and it brings about great pains and lesions.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when accidents happen to some dislocation, then it is necessary to perform reduction as soon as possible, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place becomes apostematous and very strong in what was done, making difficult the reduction of dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason it is necessary that it not be touched nor stretched at the time of apostema, because many weak points come to bring about spasm and sharp pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when that happens, then it is necessary to apply yourself to the flaubotomy of the affected part, and thereby let it rest until the apostema subsides; and thereby the limb should be wrapped in warm water and oil, and thereby reduction is facilitated.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole limb should be cared for with that of which the memory will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the chapters on dislocation according to what has been preceded in fracture; from the upper part of the body down to the lower part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the cure of dislocation of the lower jawbone.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	Thus the two jawbones are dislocated if they do not close; and the dislocation of both is made in one of two ways: either they are removed from their places with little movement, and thus mollified a little; or they are entirely dislocated and completed, until they are mollified at the part of the joint until corroding saliva of the affected part and it cannot hold that nor clear its mouth, and its tongue is enveloped in its speech.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation of it is slight, then in major preparations it returns by itself for a slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is entire and complete, then it is necessary that reduction of it be administered immediately, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister holds the head of the affected part, and meanwhile puts his fingers on one side of the jaw in the root of the dislocation of the lower jawbone inside the mouth, if the dislocation is of one side; or he puts both fingers simultaneously, if the dislocation is of two sides, and the other fingers are placed on the most affected parts; and he orders the patient to cease using his jaws and release them from any part; and the minister guides the jaw and pushes the jaw until it returns to its proper place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and especially if both jawbones are simultaneously dislocated, then administration of evaporation with warm water and oil is necessary, until the reduction of both is made easier and not delayed at all, thus as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And thus when they return and are guided, and the mouth of the affected part is closed and not mollified, then pause on those pillows of drap in cerote, and it should be made with wax and oil rubbed; and thereby it is facilitated by means of soft bandages.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head be steady between two aurelhes, so that he does not move to the right or left side; and do not force him to eat for any reason; having the healthy diet forbidden, until when the pains are removed and the jawbones are numb, then it is possible to do what one wants.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And that should be administered easily, and do not struggle over the perception of the mouth's opening, eating and drinking, until the jaw is numb and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce two dislocated jaws at any time and they are not converted to their proper places, then many vigorous febrile efforts should be made, and strongly heated soda should be applied, and the patient's belly should be strongly wrapped, and the patient should vomit pure cholera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, then you will know it is a loss; and many vigorous efforts will die in that which falls within 10 days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the ankle and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The ankle is not dislocated from its joint behind the foot; and sometimes it is dislocated forward, and that is declared by the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is when the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then bind the area with your palm in strong binding, so that it will return to its place.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then pause on that plaster and poultices and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of one who has a hernia and is continued in it, is not dislocated on any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and reset according to what we have said and according to what you have prepared.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on that plaster, and poultices, and extraction, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this method of cure, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its proper place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated upwards towards the thigh and downwards.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated above the muscle, and that is done sharply; and it is not dislocated to the back parts through the shoulder; and it is not dislocated to the front parts through the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and falls to the lower parts from the thigh, and mostly in those whose flesh is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those whose flesh is thick, it is difficult to dislocate.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And strongly it is necessary to apply percussion or massage to some men, and the patient's muscle is affected by a hot poultice, and it is seized by that which has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then it is necessary that you proceed with that until you are certain about the condition of the patient, and then you will proceed with their cure.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is recognized the dislocation of it when it is in the lower parts from the thigh; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the sound one, because you find among them diverse manifest differences; and you find in the head of the concave muscle below the thigh from the touching of the head of the muscle as if it were a vacuum, and the patient cannot reduce their hand to their proper position, nor can they do that for all movements.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the foot or above, then you will find a clear touching point, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation, an easy reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the assistant raises the hand of it to the upper parts; and then pauses with his fingers below the patient's thigh, and strengthens the joint in its proper place, and the assistant raises the hand of it, and extends it upwards; and then pauses it there until it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return through what we have said, and so from the beginning that the dislocation occurs, many days, then it is necessary that the patient be bathed in warm water and be administered a gentle massage that softens and relaxes, as if it were a coytz root of fenugrec, and melillot in water, and it should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on their back and paused below the thigh, waiting for the moment when it is settled between levitation and strictness, and then the doctor pauses his hand on the patient's spine, and raises the head of the muscle to a straight position, and attracts the patient's hand so that it is not bent towards the lower parts, and another assistant holds the patient's head, so that it is not bent towards the lower parts, because it will quickly return to its proper place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it in this way: and it is that you should be present as a helper to the patient who is more elongated than the patient, and stand on the side of that joint, and insert your hand below the patient's thigh and raise their thigh to the upper parts until the patient is suspended in air, and another assistant pulls the patient's hand from the lower parts of the back.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the patient is lighter, then it is necessary that I cover what I have suspended for another cause, so that the heavy one returns quickly, because the dislocation returns soon.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced immediately according to another method: and it is that one fixes on the ground a long stick with a rounded figure, like a pestle, which is neither large nor subtle, and places it under the patient; then, having placed the stick over the head of the stick, the patient stands according to the length of the stick, and then extends their hand to the other side of the part; and one strengthens the body on the other side with force, because the joint returns to its own place with velocity.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it for all the causes that we have mentioned, then use this cure: and it is that you take a stick of the quantity which is in length of two arm's lengths, and its width is of four fingers, and its thickness is adjusted on the edge of the thigh according to this form.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then place it over the rounded head, tied with strong bands, so that the stick does not escape from the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then place it under the thigh of the patient, and extend the hand or arm over the stick into the other side, and tie the stick to the assistant and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Then place the arm on a ladder of steps according to the width, and the hand is extended to the other side, and the other body is suspended from the other part, so that the joint enters soon.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument of it is completed according to whatever method is possible for you, and then it is necessary that you pause under the thigh a bandage of wool in equal quantity; and then prepare an emplaster made from powder of moly and album of egg white over all the muscle, so that it is revolved from above, and then strengthen below the thigh with decent structure; and the ligament is revolved over the emplaster, and the hand of it is attached to the neck of it, and it is left, and do not move the hand of it for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the food of the patient be paused for a little while, until the member is comforted, because it is lighter at the healing of it.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food is given in greater quantity, and one exercises some movement; and if it is strengthened and not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated many times due to humidity that accumulates in it or for another cause, then it is necessary that a cautery be administered with three tractions, according to what has been said in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and seven days are spent dissolving the ligament and the joint is not strengthened, and the emplaster and structure are reduced on some occasions, and it is not strengthened and cannot be elevated to the parts above, then you know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already inscribed or extended or softened, and you know that the joint will never be fixed in its own place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	For the dislocation of that which is made from the foot and the thigh or the parts behind, the reduction is made with impulse and extension in the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another structure is administered to it, and it is cured until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it accumulates towards the healing of the limb and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses many baths until that gravity is alleviated and it returns to its natural state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, and especially from the front to the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you because it falls below the vein or below the touch according to some figure that is dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip, this is declared manifestly to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch the corresponding muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And it is necessary that you hasten, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it comes to a critical point, because if it comes to a critical point, difficult is the reduction of it, and far from being fully healed; and especially when it is in the back parts, because worse is all the other species of dislocation, and of major pain, and many times it leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that its hand is extended with two hands, and its arm is expanded, and the hands of the metge are placed over the hip and below it, and the fingers of its own hands grasp the joint, or in the palm of its own hand until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is in the anterior parts, then return it thus that doubles the hand on its own, until it strikes the elbow at the wrist of the palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer a strong and forceful extension and movement.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that same thing with two ministers so that it is not removed during the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then revolve the arm from its entire part, since it is enveloped by a double layer of cloth over his hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, until that oil is applied so that it facilitates the causes that help in lubricating the joint and facilitating it; and then strongly massage the joint with a vigorous push until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of his hip that is placed on that plaster in which it is stiffened and constrained by a wrapping of egg whites, and it is strongly bound with a descending structure, and the arm is suspended from the neck, and it should be left for several days.
